ur6-vddNJkwLKAeRJE1b8Q.text: Holy sh*t, the hamburger steak is the worse I ever had in my life. My wife ordered a mix plate with that and kalbi ribs, and I ordered the plate. Also, my wife's plate (hamburger steak and kalbi ribs) they put the gravy all over the ribs too. Anytime you get a mix plate with something with gravy and something without, you supposed to separate them with a piece of foil or wax paper or something, hell, stuff a damn 2x4 in there if you have to! She opens her plate and the ribs are soaked with gravy. People order kalbi for the flavor, like it just came off the grill, but not this one. Ended up being soggy ribs that taste like brown gravy. 2 stars is because they refunded us,I mean... they had to

Sr1PCdXVRUEl-YTuVlhPAA.text: Huge portions and great service is found at Island Flavor express. Stopped in last night to grab some dinner to go. It was my first time here but thanks to the many Yelp reviews I already knew I wanted to try the furikake chicken and kalbi ribs.   There was no wait and we were greeted as we walked in. It took about 10 minutes and our order was ready. Just picking up the bag I could tell there was a lot of food in there. When I got home I couldn't  believe the portion size. Definitely enough for lunch the next day and I am not a small eater!   The furikake chicken was really good, cooked well and I liked the flavor of it. The kalbi ribs were hit and miss. The flavor was great with lots of nice crispy pieces. However they were really fatty and quite thick cut. The kalbi I am used to are much thinner. The two scoops of rice and mac salad were also good to complete the mixed plate.   Glad I stopped in to try them out. Would definitely stop in again if in the area.

B86ji91HIGknTaRPyKkF1g.text: I would say my favorite Hawaiian restaurant at the moment!  I've been to the Island Flavor out in Durango a few years ago and I liked it then. I've obviously forgotten how good it was, but now very glad that they've opened this one on Eastern!  Kind of dangerous that it's near by LVAC (gym we go to) because it's an easy "postworkout" place!  Things we ordered : Loco Moco - Juicy, thick, beef patty over rice, topped with eggs (cooked in your way), drizzled with brown gravy!  Furikake Chicken - The Hawaiian version of orange chicken? Chunky, chicken chunks, fried then tossed in this salty sweet sauce! SO GOOD!  Yakisoba with Teri Chicken - Pan friend noodles with veggies, BBQ pork, eggs, onions, and of course grilled teriyaki chicken! Great comfort food!  Their Mac Salad is also amazing, comes with most of the plates!  BIG PORTIONS, might be a good a idea to share plates!  Island Flavor definitely has that authentic taste in their dishes, service is fast and staff are nice and attentive!  A minus in my part would be the tall tables and one regular table. I'm 4'9'' so it was a little difficult going back and forth from the drink machine to table, also making sure my little one didn't move to much so he wouldn't fall (not kid friendly)!  Other than that, definitely a favorite!

UuDKJ5EziCm4tfOTGYzVnw.text: This is a great place to get flavorful and authentic local food. We came here after an appointment in the area because of the good reviews, and boy it did not disappoint. We both got combo plate with furikake chicken and teri beef (came with mac salad and rice). Let me just say that the portions are HUGE! We could have easily shared one combo since we both took more than half home!  We also ordered half pound of hawaiian style poke and it was so good and so fresh! The flavors were seriously amazing, we could not stop eating. I would be honestly come just for the poke! The seating area is small, so if it is busy I can't imagine there being much seating. My only negative is that it was fat the most expensive hawaiian food I've had out, but with the super huge portions and delicious flavor.. definitely worth it! I like to support small establishments like this because they truly work hard and take pride in what they do. Aside from the great food and friendly staff, I was digging the island tunes.   I will definitely be back here again. I just hope they make another location some where northwest!

1aalnKM5g04D4nHmYk8O2g.text: I expected a really mindblowing experience after all the hype around the original location and the positive comparisons drawn between the two, but the Eastern outpost of this restaurant lands merely in the "really good" category.  Island Flavor Express is in the Regal Colonnade plaza on Eastern and Pebble, and it's very clearly a Hawaiian restaurant given all the depictions of the islands, reggae/ska music, and typical plate lunch menu options. They also offer varying specials and some desserts, although the desserts seemed to have run out in the waning evening hours. The decor is very simple but doesn't detract from the experience. Make sure to walk to the far end of the counter to place an order, but feel free to sit down if you're not taking it to-go. They'll bring the food out to your counter (or table, if you've picked the one table).  I ordered the mixed plate ($11.25) with Furikake Chicken and Kalbi Short Ribs (+$1.00 for this particular meat). It's presented in a foam to-go box even if you're dining in. My favorite part was actually the macaroni salad, which was salted in a good way, and as creamy as you'd expect. The chicken was kinda like the "KFC" at Gen Korean BBQ in a not-so-good way. It has more of a dry, stringy texture than a moist, natural chicken texture, and the furikake didn't stand out as much as the sweet glaze did. Sriracha saved the day though, bestowing a little extra sweetness along with much-needed acidity and heat. I don't like having to add a condiment to make something stand out, but I'm very glad that I had the option.  As for the other parts of the dish, the white rice is cooked perfectly, and the kalbi is a great rendition with tender beef, a nice touch of ginger, and some charring. It's a little on the fatty side, but let's remember that fat = flavor, which was proven in this case. Actually, it has muted sweetness when you eat it after something as sweet as the Furikake Chicken, but I was able to taste the full flavor when I dove into my my leftovers. If I get a mixed plate again with kalbi, I'll probably have to go for something like a pork dish that's not so sweet.  My friend shared a spam musubi ($2) with me. It was a nice-sized portion, but the rice ratio was a bit high for me. Also, the seaweed was a little too mushy, which my friend pointed out may be a side-effect of the heat lamp. Although there are interesting seasonings and herbs in Island Flavor's version, I prefer the Ross J's rendition, which I'm sure is prepped to order.  I also tried my friend's oxtail soup ($10), which actually comes in a real bowl if you're dining in. Unfortunately, I can't compare it to the renowned Hawaiian oxtail soup at that one hotel downtown (because I've yet to try it), but this version tasted well-seasoned and meaty. The vegetables are a welcome sight, but watch out for the not-so-edible ginger and the inedible bay leaf. I'd consider ordering it again, especially now that we're getting soup weather daily, although I might have to make it a to-go order or otherwise bring my own soup spoon to avoid dealing with the inadequate plastic spoons.  Given that the food here is reportedly much the same as OG Island Flavor, I wasn't quite as impressed as I'd hoped. I certainly enjoyed having plenty of leftovers with the huge portions, and I'll definitely come back to try their other proteins and specials (pork chops w/ mushrooms and onions, anyone?), but I expected to experience something "sublime" other than the music. Maybe I'll find it in the future.

qhoiRv-Dar0gVJL2t7_uWw.text: I don't get why this place has a 4.5 average rating. I JUST finished eating (what I managed to eat) and after 1 short rib, I was over it.   Look at all my pictures, and you'll see what I'm talking about.   Short ribs: waaaaaaay too much fat. After eating just 1 short rib, I had a big pile of fat sitting on a napkin. And nibbling on the bones is usually my favorite part about short ribs. I couldn't do it with these because I refuse to eat pure fat.  Furikake chicken: the majority of the serving was the crumbs/breading. There were only a few big pieces of chicken.   Korean short ribs: mushy and all breading.   Don't get me wrong, the flavoring of the short ribs and furikake chicken were good, but the execution was a huge disappointment. Sometimes trying new places isn't always a good thing.

o2Q1-7iMMW4ksxgSXIEXlQ.text: I'm in love with the saturation of Hawaiian restaurants in the Las Vegas area (of which the East coast surely misses out on) and another welcome addition is Island Flavor.  The prices are slightly higher than some of its competitors but the quantity and good flavor surely makes up for that.  There are quite a few options of fresh ahi tuna poke here.  I ordered 1/2 a pound of Hawaiian style poke.  The cuts of tuna they used were very large and quite fresh.  It was marinated in a soy and chili flake sauce with some minced onions thrown in the mix.  Pretty good option for poke in my area.  The mixed plate we ordered was fairly good as well.  Furikake chicken was spot on, kind of like crispy orange chicken but with more flavor from the furikake seasoning.  The kalbi short ribs ($1.00 more) were good and came as 2 huge pieces of meat.   There's quite a bit of fat on edges which I did not eat and one of our meats came out a little more red on the inside than my wife likes to eat.  Luckily, I have no problem with that.  I've glanced over some of the breakfast options and saw the Portuguese sausage and eggs at over $8.    That's $3 more than I'm used to for a standard breakfast option.  I decided to get a side of the Portuguese sausage but they were considerably smaller and not as good as my go to spot for Portuguese sausage (Aloha Kitchen next to UNLV for those wondering-amazing).  For the closest location with good poke and friendly service, I'll definitely keep Island Flavor in mind.  Truly a good mixed plate with plenty of left overs for a second meal.

pCBgjMIYjr5fjYr98RLijA.text: Was in town for a night and checked Yelp for something close by to eat. After striking out at two other nearby locations with great reviews (closed cause it was Black Friday) we tried Island Flavor. It was smaller than I had imagined, one unit in a small strip mall. There were maybe 6 small tables along the wall, but people were filing in and out at a steady pace. Very busy, but that could have been due to it being Black Friday and many other restaurants were closed. I ordered the miso ahi steaks, perfectly cooked with a tasty sauce and rice, my wife got teriyaki chicken, also very good. The staff was friendly and even attentive, unexpected, considering it was more of a fast food atmosphere. Both meals together cost about $20. Accommodations could have been more friendly/inviting if they had a bigger location, but I think they cater more to take out. If  you're not a fan of the hustle & bustle, get it to go, it's worth it. Very Good food

SHn690_NgtDs3ZEj7Ui3rg.text: How many of you loyal diners of Island Flavor know that this business was sold in Dec. of 2017.  Bruce and Maili no longer are the owners of this business and now its owned by Viaggio-Vita-llc, a haole owned company.  Not knocking the new owners but the food quality has gone down and the taste is no longer the same.  A lot of the old time workers are no longer here and the Hawaiian music is gone, maybe forever.   A lot of new young servers are now working here which is good because they still bring the Hawaiian Mana.  Sad to say but because of changes in taste and quality of the food don't think we'll be coming back anytime soon.  Need to find another good Hawaiian restaurant again. Even the fast food outlet on Eastern was sold to the same guys that bought the original store.  SAD.  Good luck to Bruce and Maili and thanks for the wonderful years of dining experience.. Aloha oe.  One thing I've noticed is the new cooks working here.  I don't think they have the experience of Island cooking at all and our order was totally screwed.  Grand daughters spam rice came really late, and our poke didn't show up till we asked what happened.  Heard the cooks telling the servers not to ask for the food because they were backed up on orders, never seen or heard that before.  Wow what a disgraceful action from the kitchen.  Korean chicken tasted funny, Kalbi tasted over cooked, Katsu chicken came out a bit burnt and slightly hard, ummm what is going on here?   Well, good luck to all who visit, and hopefully things will change for the better.

DzzwEJ8np7s6zvW5ysA2AA.text: If you want a delicious, hearty meal that will more than fill you up, come to island flavor. Get yourself a mixed plate and try everything. Upgrade to their delicious fried rice with juicy pieces of pork in it. This time around I got furikake chicken which is sweet, crispy and has that touch of seaweed which is really good. My son is into short ribs right now so we got the kalbi as the second meat. Amazing. You get the meat options, fried rice, a little cabbage at the bottom, and their side of delicious Mac salad! The coworkers and I always hit up the Durango location, this one is identical. Other dishes I've tried are the chicken Katsu loco mojo and poke. When that gravy mixes with steamed rice something magical happens . Seriously go try it. Ask for some sriracha on the side and enjoy!

bsQAY9dJ3e6sP_afCeOL-w.text: Best Hawaiian food in Las Vegas.  Seriously.  The food is amazing.  Ordered take out tonight for dinner.  Got two mix plates to share between my fiance and I.  Highly recommend these items. 1. Furikake Chicken - Freaking Delicious!! 2. Teriyaki Steak - Super Tender strips of steaks in Teriyaki Sauce 3. Roast Pig with Gravy - Super Super Tender chunks of Roast Pork in Gravy 4. Kalbi Ribs - Delicious  5. Hawaiian style Poke  Their portions are out of control.  They give you a lot of food.  The flavors are soooo good. You won't be disappointed at all.

9Vwx60zAJuatWA4BbKfoNA.text: I'm so happy I found this place. It's great for lunch.  This location is east of the strip and it's considered "express."  I guess their menu isn't as extensive as the other location on the west side of the strip.  Parking was easy to find; they have a small lot in front of the restaurant.  They also have restrooms in the back and condiments/utensils in the front by the sodas.    The menu is on the wall in front of the kitchen.  I ordered a combo of kalbi and furikaki chicken.  I wanted to try the pork, but maybe on a next visit.  The combo came with a side of macaroni salad, and I opted for white rice instead of brown rice.  Both meats were delicious.  Furikaki chicken is something I've never heard of before, and I love furikaki!  It's a bit on the sweet side, so I recommend getting it in the combo.    I'll definitely be back next time - maybe to try the poke, too!

-6ftNxTBkH_W9HDxxLB11Q.text: This is my cheat meal to the max!  Salty, meaty and oh so good.    The chicken furikake is battered, deep fried and then glazed in this teriyaki-like sauce.  The batter has a good crunch despite the glaze and it's an addictive dish.  Knowing it's deep fried, I tend to shy away from these types of food, but I can never come to Island Flavor and not order this dish.    The pulehu ribs has a dry rub versus the kalbi ribs more of a saucy seasoning are both salted heavy.  I always have to order my dish light on the sauce and the chef is more than happy to obliged.  I get an option to have brown rice instead of white rice, and then I replace my mac salad with sauteed vegetables.  This place offers a good medium for me.  Even though I'm having a cheat meal, I still get a dose of my healthier options.    The kalua pig is smokey, light on the salt, and you can't go wrong with shredded pork.   This is a definite must try if you're craving Hawaiian flavors for plate lunch style.  It's on top of my list of restaurant to eat while in the city of Henderson.  I'm hooked and have cravings that knows no bounds.     They close early on Sundays at 4p.m., so don't come late and disappoint yourself, like many before.

3UFvZIF3-npi7q90v7BFhQ.text: so heres the 411 this place has the best dam chicken/furikake dish in vegas !! give the chicken out of 1-10 a 20 yo ;) .. but side note the short ribs are really really salty but i as tender as can be ...short beef out of 1-10 a 3...sorry just way to heavy handed on the sodium... the Macaroni is solid light and refreshing with pepper in it,oh boy thats the secret lil pepper !!the place is good lil on pricey side but yeah, like i said the furikake chicken is the realist ...id go back just for that !!count me sold on that ...so yeah would of gave 5 if short ribs werent power salty ...one other thing really great about this spot is they have good portions as well...in that being said i  say come by as a vegas must to try that furikake chicken cause its beautiful, and made with love !!! keep up the great work you guys and youll be vegas best in no time rock on !

dUeAwBw6GvaEayoxUiizEw.text: A flavor definitely reminiscent of the Hawaiian islands! A local stop that myself and my girlfriend (who is from Hawai'i) will constantly visit when we're in the area if we wanted taste a piece of her motherland.  We ordered their Shoyu Poke and their Furikake Chicken during this visit.  First off, the poke and the way it's cut is definitely how traditional poke should be. It was seasoned really well, close to perfection, however, this time around the seasoning was a little bit more salty than what I remembered. Still better than any poke place in California that claims to have traditional Hawaiian poke (besides North Shore, which is really close to traditional), however, as I said, it was a little bit too salty this time around. Next, is the Furikake Chicken, which is definitely something myself and my girlfriend every single time we visit Las Vegas. The crispiness of the chicken was really good, and it seemed this time they added more sauce, which I absolutely loved! For me it was very flavorful, and mixed with the warm rice they served along with it gave it a nice balance of heat and flavors in my mouth. A good balance of sweet and salty.

1ZhCqCKAYO1o3o9Hb2naMw.text: The staff was really friendly and the restaurant was clean. It was my cheat meal so I went with the Loco Moco as well as a side of the guava cake. Loco Moco was perfect with the massive hamburger patty drenched in delicious gravy over a huge bed of rice. The eggs was over easy and cooked to perfection. That's always a good measure on how well people can cook as how they produce egg dishes.  The guava cake was a nice balance of flavor and sweetness and was not to filling so I was able to finish it off at the end of a meal. I think I love this location better than the one in Southwest Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco moco and a side of guava cake. Omg so filling.

KQE_ARGJAOHcTcHQ2Y18ag.text: Stopped by for a quick lunch around 12:30pm and barely missed the lunch rush! The place itself has a decent amount of seating but would not recommend this place for large groups, probably for parties of 4 or less. Now onto the food:  Mixed Plate (Kalbi and Furikake Chicken) - would definitely recommend sharing this. You get a choice of rice, brown rice (no extra charge), or fries. You also get a choice of macaroni salad or salad. The furikake chicken was sooooo good and the seasoning was on point! The kalbi was a bit chewy and not all the pieces were flavored well so I would recommend trying something else. Macaroni salad was decent. I just wish they had more sauces to eat with the rice.

0FOnWcFcG9k665vp-uVoVg.text: JUST GO. This company consistently makes some of the best island food that I've had in the lower 48. Every time I come to Las Vegas, I actually get excited to eat Island Flavor again. This is their quickie express version with counter service and a few tables.   First things first: haupia cake. It's perfect in texture, and the haupia flavor is subtle and beautiful. I ate dessert while waiting a few minutes for my plate lunch. (The cream on it isn't particularly special, but the rest of the cake is PERFECT.)   Next: unless you are Michael Phelps or the god Maui out of the movie Moana, these meals are filling enough for two people to share. Holy hell, there's so much fatty, delicious food that it's surely grave to your health on a regular basis. It's all good quality and done with great flavors. They are on the sweet side, but my favorites are the furikake chicken and short ribs.   Like Durango's location, the service here is so unbelievably kind that you can't help but wish the whole world could live life like that everyday. (To the lady working today, THANK YOU. So much aloha in your heart that the world must be a better place because you are in it!)   They have daily specials posted on the wall when you walk in and everything legit Hawaiian on the menu, including all those glorious Pacific Rim fusion meals.   I'm at McCarran waiting to go home and packed my leftovers in a Tupperware. I even had to tell the TSA guy to eat here when he did a bag check for me. This is one of my favorite local businesses to support!

Island Flavor has huge portions and their prices can't be beat.  The only item that I have ever had at this location is their Loco Moco.  In my opinion, Island Flavor has the best Loco Moco in Las Vegas.  The patties are huge/thick, you get a lot of eggs, and there's tons of rice & gravy.  After eating here, I'm set for at least 3.7 hours.  I look forward to coming back when I'm in the area.    2017 Yelp Review #37

Interior is on the smaller side, but usually not an issue since I do mostly to-go orders.  *****Yelp 2016 100 Challenge***** 72/100

9ukKhEyBsNFOLjlJYIQFMg.text: Pretty good Hawaiian food here. Service was prompt and friendly. The place is clean and the food is straight forward. I like the fact that they cook to order so the food is hot and fresh. I ordered the mix plate of Kalbi short ribs and furikake chicken. The Kalbi short ribs were tender and flavorful, but some of the ribs were more fat than meat. The furikake chicken are pieces of chicken deep fried in a sweet and savory sauce which was pretty tender and tasty. They also sell masubi, which are sushi rolled Spam. They masubi was really big, but since I ordered a lot of food I decided to try it next time. They were also selling a chantilly guava with huapia cake, which I asked about and the person said it was like a chocolate cake with a yellow something, they personally haven't tried it, but the worker said people like it. May I'll try it next time. Also,  I opted for sauteed veggies instead of the macoroni salad for my first try here. Unfortunately, the sauteed veggie butter sauce ended up leaking all over the bag inside. The rest of the food held up fine though. Food was good and service was friendly. Will give this place another try, but will double bag to-go orders just in case.

tpM_L8I9gqpAOT1hJT9x2A.text: i usually visit the restaurant on the other side of LV. but overall, everything was a bit off on the last visit. i wrote my review and someone from island flavor wrote back apologizing and asking me to come back as they had fixed some of the items i had mentioned!  that's a winning management--responsive.  i'll be happy to come back--really, how can i stay away?  :)  ok, now for the original review:  teri beef:  a solid bit too salty. and even though cut properly (against the grain), still tough. macaroni salad: sadly, it was served super cold! couldn't taste it.  i think they need to turn that fridge down a few degrees! then again, if you're doing take out, that thing is the perfect temperature by the time you get home. poke--was ok this visit. got the hawaii one with limu.  friendly service, lots of local people hanging out. i wish they could have someone bring them a BIB of the real strawberry flavored fruit punch from the islands instead of the tropicana version. i like the fanta syrup, but it's easy to get the big box at restaurant supply places--they're even near the airport. :)  i'd be happy to volunteer to bring you guys a box next time i have to bring checked luggage anyway. or maybe LV coke distributor can nab some for you guys. :)

p1sQBzQ2Fq2_2miRKG1Pww.text: Okay Island Flavor. We see you!!   Kids wanted Musubis for dinner, and some local grinds sounded so ono, so Island Flavor was next on the rotation. And I'm pretty sure the rotation stops here. Look no further for fresh, traditional, island favorites, with fantastic friendly service. We really felt like ohana tonight.   Kalbi is so tender and succulent, Furikake Chicken is more flavorful than any I've ever had on the mainland, and the Teryaki Chicken... Well let's just say the kids ate almost a whole plate to themselves, and they're damn picky! Hubby says their mac salad rivals mine, and that's saying a lot (and I may have to agree). (Food was too good, no pictures this time!)  Complete with Pass-O-Guava and Lilikoi Hawaiian Suns, this meal was so worth every penny (just bummed we passed on the Haupia cake that we had last time... Next time for sure cause that stuff is like legal crack), I'm positive we will be frequent offenders here!  And bonus thank you to the awesome "Auntie" for the extra musubis! Kids are so stoked!!! You guys are now their favorite, and ours as well!

We got an order of poke, one order of fried poke, and a order of the Kahlua pork. All of it was incredible. I'd tell you what flavors of each we got, but we let the cashier pick whatever she recommended, so I can't remember). Poke was fresh, tasty, and plentiful in each of our half orders and the kahlua pork looked unseasoned, but the taste was perfection. They need to expand asap, but definitely worth your time (even like us, driving from the strip).

HttTC_-PD_Fv4-kDQXzowA.text: Another solid local 808 food in Vegas. I have been to the other location on Durango. Not much difference in the food for the most part pretty consistent BIG portions and solid local food. I believe the menu at Express is half the size? Not like the menu at Durango location that more like book open up couple pages here just one page action. The dishes on the menu here seem to be the popular items or for me the local food enjoy the most! They run daily different specials so might want call in see if you tried the whole menu or want something else. I came to get dinner on the way home from KONA viewing party. I got steered from the one and only Shirley B get me some Furikake Chicken. Winnah! For the most part most of the pieces was good size although have to admit or agree with Marie T some of it was more deep fried crumbs. The portion size is so big but really good at same time. The sauce really enjoyed! They do put lot of sauce but then again everything here is huge including the sauce. I literally had half my two scoops of rice soaked in it. In good way.  I got some Poke action. I got the Hawaiian Style Poke Half Order. It was good. The quality of the tuna was solid, the sauce was ok, and best part was the limu. It been long time since had some. It adds so much flavor to any Poke. Good. I feel down the road Poke Express is much better and they have better selection. I would still order the Poke again if needed get my fix in.  Overall definitely place would stop by again!

In all my life (66 years) eating loco moco back home in Hawaii or here at many places over the last 21 years in Las Vegas, I've never had a tough, overcooked hamburger steak. Hope it was just a one time thing. It was probably because they were busy: I called about 8 times which no one picked up on any of the calls.  I ended up calling the other location to check if the Express restaurant had closed down. The other location told me they already had several of the same phone calls since no one was picking up in Henderson.  Finally, I went there to order in person. Either way, it really shouldn't be an excuse for an overcooked hamburger steak because I spent over $100. on 5 meals plus a bunch of side dishes. However, I'll give them another shot and see what their specials are like i.e., sweet sour spareribs on Wednesdays.

UAiAIQJXsPuFTR95_jpFjQ.text: I've been looking for a place that serves great saimin.  Island Flavor was suggested, but it's not like what we get in Hawaii.  The dashi (soup) was not  flavorful enouhh, but this is the only thing we tried so I cannot speak for the other food.  We will be going back and trying other items.  Stay tuned.

RLFTX_WO-7qgZNoIjzpfEw.text: This is by far the best Hawaiian food in Las Vegas, I've been to several and this place hit the spot in flavor, portions and quality! Highly recommended, nice people inside, great for dining in and nice soft subtle tunes to go along with it!

HPGljPi6seM9h-7Ho66FzQ.text: This is one of those places that I've been going to for about 6 years but have never done a review for. It's probably because when I get my food I eat it so fast I forget to take pictures.   This is the second of 2 locations. The other location is the larger restaurant with a full menu. This location is the smaller one with a condensed menu of some of the local favorites. Each day they have a list of specials that help expand their menu options. They also have a cooler with Hawaiian sun juices and some local desserts to complete your meal.   Today we got the kalua pig with no cabbage, 1/2 order of ahi poke with avocado and mixed plate with teriyaki chicken and hamburger steak.   Kalua pig comes with 2 scoops rice and Mac salad which taste great. They use corse ground pepper which makes it have a more peppery taste but I like it. The kalua pig is good. Not to salty, not to smoky, juuuuust right.   The ahi poke is good and one of my wife's favorites. It has just enough sauce without drowning out the flavor of the fish.   The mixed plate was great. It also comes with Mac salad and 2 scoops of rice. This is the first time I've had their Teri chicken and I must say that it was sooooo good. The marinade is on point and the grilled flavor kicks it up a notch. I will for sure order that again on its own. The hamburger steak was good. They have one of the best gravy around.   If you go be prepared for friendly service and good food.

Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside the restaurant. There are tables on the right side.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalua pig. My son got to it before I could take a picture. He loves it.

WV5uemAqSvPvfxgjOSojaQ.text: We love this place!  Fresh ahi poke with avacado! Chicken katsu! Kalbi! Mac salad! The works!!!  Attention all locals in Las Vegas stop by this place! You won't be disappointed!

OUUrRSjkEmV5-PEREWQ3UQ.text: You can not go wrong with delicious Hawaiian food that has great flavors and enormous portion sizes! This restaurant is located in a small plaza on Eastern and Pebble just across from the gas station. Compared to the bigger restaurant that's located on the southwest side of the valley, this Island Flavor is much small and can get packed very easily.   I do both dine-in and takeout and they serve their food out just on time when you think about how big of a size & quality that they're giving.  Their cashiers are very courteous and professional. And I love that good-vibe type of feel when you enter and leave the front door.   Just a side note for those unaware of the changes, they have slightly increase some of their menu items and they have a note posted on their front store. Other than this slight downfall, they still continue to serve delicious food that me, my family, and friends crave for!   When it comes to Hawaiian food overall, you can't beat this 'diamond in the rough' type of restaurant.

6x6UCyiqi_WZvme0t_N-ww.text: Island flavor is probably the best Hawaiian restaurant I have ever been to! The furikake chicken is top notch. Prices are affordable and portions are large for what you are paying. Definitely check this place out and try the furikake chicken!

AqgrQH41KOOuTswH6TLwVA.text: Authentic Hawaiian grind.  Poke home style, delicious. We had the Hawaiian style poke- a little spicy- but still ono.  Kalua pig with cabbage, spot on.  They have daily specials here - just like on the island. Today's special was beef stew. One word ono.  We also had a side of kimchee- it was a little sour. I know some like it sour, but not for me. The mac salad had pepper in it. A different twist, it had a little too much for my taste - a little less and it would have been perfect. The food is made to order - so each dish is fresh.  We also had spam musibi - also ono.  This place has the look and vibe of the island.  Definitely a great place to get your grind on!

3mYddEtvFVgc13YoSA6MKQ.text: Great authentic Hawaiian food, great aloha spirit from the employees that is felt from the time you walk in and they even played traditional island music! h48qgW4rbhOAu7RqKJAebA.text: Was driving by when I saw this spot, went in on a limb and I was not disappointed. Great spot, Furikake chicken is awesome. Friendly staff.

dRglHb7QMQ5QyRCQJZ4Mvg.text: Genuine and excellent food. Better poke than some even in Hawaii. Service friendly. Will be back.

BbN3Q1B2qwFXvqbdUK26yg.text: This place USE TO BE GOOD.... ever since new owner took over.... QUALITY and QUANTITY dropped like a broken 20 lb bag rice!!!  Even L&L in the worst part of town is better than here now!!!! Shame on new owners for cutting corners!!!! Uncle Bruce and Aunty maile worked hard to build island flavors reputation and name and to destroy their legacy on "flavor"-less food is not pono!!!

pthXNWiO1FgSWomkvzx_JQ.text: Island flavor is by far the best Hawaiian food that you can find in Las Vegas Nevada. This trip I ordered the Furikake chicken, the macaroni salad, the white rice, brown rice, the sliced pork with gravy, the pork Adobo and the teriyaki chicken!   The FURIKAKE chicken was insane! It was literally the best chicken dish that I have had of the sort. They somehow managed to tackle having crispy edges on their succulent moist chicken pieces. The chicken is sauteed in their sauce that can only be likened to A General Tsaos chicken minus the peppers with a little FURIKAKE seasoning. This sauce is a perfect balance of savory, citrus, honey glazed goodness!   The Mac salad was extremely fresh and well put together. I definitely enjoyed it as well.  Unfortunately, the sliced pork with gravy I received was slightly overcooked to the point where I couldn't really enjoy it. However with that being said, the pork and the gravy went together extremely well and I could tell  had this dish not been over cooked it would've been one of my favorites as well.  We really enjoyed the pork adobo as well. We ate a small portion of it. Then save the rest to put on top of salads!   The only thing that I can say that is non-positive is that the brown rice was extremely overcooked to the point where it was mushy and not edible.

VqOxWIsrQ6JTDV4Mb2ktQQ.text: I love the chicken and short ribs very flavorful but the quality of the chicken isn't that great I find myself eating the fried part and tarnishing the rest

ZyHjsr6yK9my3awcMYvOHg.text: Extremely disappointed with my meal. This has been a favorite of mine since I first tried it 2 years ago. My go-to was the combo plate, with teriyaki steak and furikake shrimp.   During my latest visit, I ordered online and picked up my order. When I got home and opened the box, it already looked different. The shrimp was fried, but the sauce was on the side. The sauce was also not the sauce I was used to; it was just sweet chili sauce, like the one you eat with egg rolls. Not a fan. The steak was a cut I wasn't sure that I've had before. Either that, or it was just extremely overcooked sirloin.   To top it off, the amount that was listed during my online order and the amount I was charged at the restaurant was different! It was actually $2 more, and I didn't notice until way after. I read on here that there was an ownership change recently. The entire encounter was just very disappointing.

wEJypokvjgIcXNFGuCodQg.text: The service I'd always good. The food is amazing!!  Fried saimin is so ono Meat Jun is so tasty , don't even need the sauce but it it makes it better  Mandoo is soft and crispy..  Love it!!!

8elSX64KoE-lgETqm8LKUQ.text: This is my new favorite place. About 3 days ago i ordered the furikake chicken and a hawaiian poke bowl! My husband and I shared and were equally full...very worth it. Although when they do get busy it gets really crowded but the staff is quick.. the cashier was very helpful at recommending us some choices. she had many people to tend to but handled it very well we got our food i believe before 10 mins. Great place overall.

STT4bRoJClmKfdFtj4ssXQ.text: Huge portions go hungry  The furiyake chicken has a lot of inedible pieces for me. Ligaments and such attached that I kept spitting out.  The sauce is mild and I didn't find it flavorful. The same goes for the sauce in Korean fried chicken. Mild nothing exciting.   The teriyaki beef was delicious. The sauce was put on after cooking and not caramelized at all.   The short ribs were delicious   They had different sugary canned drinks from Hawaii. Nice option over soda.   Great service.   Great Value  Chicken wasn't great. Stick with the beef.   The smell of the left overs grossed me out and I threw it out.   I probably wouldn't go back

WZqJIJNB40wGJhjrhfpLnw.text: I am so behind the curve when it comes to dining spots east of the 15. Even my long time Yelp buddy Rod from Hawaii knows about this place, dine here with his poker buds and written a review nearly a year ago.  Sad face!!!  So, I spent a good chunk of today on Yelp researching for places to eat, those that may offer lunch or dinner or daily specials, as well as those that are closed on Mondays. Yeah, I am not afraid to admit I research potential places I might eat at the way some people research and plan their European vacation. But with the WiFi sporadically cutting in and out, which the Cox technician blames on the 2 year old Netgear router, this impromptu query took longer than expected. By the time I narrowed down my list and picked a spot I was already very hungry and is way past the time for a Hobbit's second lunch.  Luckily, Island Flavor Express was just a few minutes drive on surface street without too much traffic.  Finding a parking space was also not that difficult, although I did have to drive to the side of the building to locate a vacant parking spot that is not designated as short term 30 minutes parking.  Upon walking in, I saw their Today's Special and after a quick glance I opted to ordered their Kimchi Fried Rice with Korean Chicken Wings, instead of the Furikake Chicken that helped secured my decision to come here today in the first place.  Yeah, when it comes to food I am fickle like that.  None of that boring 60's diner conversation that either starts or ends with "have the usual" for me.  So after a few minutes the lady that took my order dropped off a to go box filled with my Kimchi Fried Rice surrounded my a mob of Korean Chicken Wings (the container was closed). Even without picking it up, I can tell/edumaguess that it was going to be substantial from the soft thud that it made when it made contact with the surface of the table. But I could totally have hallucinated it as a result of the low blood sugar level.  But picking it up only confirmed my 6th sense was not off at all.  How about that :)  The Kimchi Fried Rice also contains pieces of chasu, not just kimchi as one would suspect. It is decent, not the best I've had, but the portion is definitely on the high end of the spectrum for serving size.  The Korean Chicken Wings are cooked nicely, but is not sticky like the ones served at Korean Fried Chicken spots around town. But after awhile the whole meal elevates your sodium level, and as much as I love Hawaiian Sun products with Island grub, a single can is not enough. So plan ahead, buy 2 cans at $1.25 each or get soda from the fountain or water.  I'd totally be back again, hopefully for the Furikake Chicken, in the not too distant future.  Price: 4-5/5. very reasonable for the portions you get.  Parking: 4-5/5. plenty, just might have to walk a bit if the spaces directly out front are not available.  Tastes: 4/5. Nothing fancy, but pretty good and worth coming back for more.

9Ch00Ziyzoqz1zHyI1SB5w.text: Island Flavor was packed when I came for lunch on a weekday. It took a while to get our food (~20 min) for take out but at least it was fresh! I tried a Mixed Plate of Kalbi Ribs and Chicken Katsu and my boyfriend had the Furikake Chicken. The portions are hugeee! The plate comes with 2 scoops of rice and a side of maraconi salad.   They gave me 6 Kalbi ribs for a mixed order which is great but the ribs themselves were very  thick, chewy and fatty ): I didn't like eating them too much. The Chicken Katsu was disappointing too since it wasn't very crispy. My boyfriend scored with his order though. The Furikake Chicken was seasoned perfectly and really does taste like furikake! The chicken was crispy and tender; I would definitely recommend this dish. The macaroni salad was delicious and one of our favorites as well.  I would give this place 3.5 stars, so a 4 rounding up. Although I was disappointed with the Kalbi and Chicken Katsu, the awesomeness of the Furikake Chicken made up for it. I recommend skipping the Kalbi and Katsu and trying something different!

HUakPXJBSDtvwdDmKkAuYg.text: Ordered Kalua without cabbage and they accidentally cooked it with. I told them I didn't mind, and cashier told me if I didn't like it they'd recook it. I ate it anyway and in the middle of my meal she brought me kalua without cabbage for free! Great food and excellent customer service!

nv7t6gDuKa_Jn0a2HYrubw.text: Can't be better than this. Food is exactly on point. When you order Hawaiian it supposed to be a certain way and this is the way it's supposed to be.  They pile the food on. It's funny because I reviewed another Hawaiian place not long ago and complained about the how their portions were too big. Well the big difference here is they give you a lot of delicious food unlike that other place that gives you a bunch of nasty food.  Kalbi here is very good. They give plenty. Ahi poke is fresh and delicious. Furikake chicken has really good flavor.  I'm a regular now. I will be here weekly for sure.

ZbyrMx7Mr-VNXa8GIRex7g.text: Best Hawaiian local food in Vegas! Isaiah is friendly with great customer service. Chef Steven cooked the furikake chicken and kalibi efficiently and it was onolicious. I would recommend this place to everyone!

cS-5R5HzInfwOgKPhsUtSw.text: This is my favorite "local Hawaiian" food restaurant.  Huge portions that tastes great.  I usually get their sweet and sour spare ribs and the chicken long rice specials when they have them but everything's good there.  If you like "broke the mouth taste and fill the opu portions" this is the place to go.

3KS1kOvnUxqwUaGGV3sDLQ.text: Straight Dynamite! Great food, very affordable, good service, fantastic cooks. Pig and cabbage is the best I've ever had. Mushibos to go are big and delicious and $2. Hot bento boxes for super fast takeout. Chili water on the tables! Since I found it I eat here once to twice a week.

Lz-xNo7Y5Buiu3V5p3KXqQ.text: Have been there 3 times since they opened last week. 1st visit: sweet & sour spareribs: onolicious. Wife got poke salad. Large portion and really tasty. 2nd visit: furikake chicken:  oh so good. The wife got the loco moco. She loved it!  Today, 3rd time. Laulau Friday. Oh yeah with Komi salmon, mac salad & haupia for dessert. So Ono. You gotta go there!

mNjGSdhp2Ltp0V2GML5gbg.text: Went here 3 times and tried different things. It's just okay. I wouldn't come back again. Idk why people from Hawaii say its good here bc I've had WAYYYY better back home. This is like a zippys to me. Just mediocre. Spam musabi had no furikake, it's  literally just nori, rice and spam. Even the 711 spam musabis are better than this! Even my homemade one is better lol. Furikake ckn didn't taste like furikake ckn it tasted like garlic ckn with a dash of furikake and SUPERRR salty. Forgot what I got before that but I guess it goes to show you how spectacular I think this place is. Oh I also tried the guava cake. Worst cake ever. Taste nothing like guava and actually ruined the taste I had in my head of the good guava and chiffon cakes back home. Maybe you guys been away from the island too long that you forgot what REAL hawaii food taste like. Sadly they are supposedly from Hawaii too. Your best bet for hawaiian/hawaii food is cinnamons!

JTCcqZvQ4ZGhtqqqVRfl5Q.text: Best island food in Vegas! We had furikake chicken, katsu, teri beef and avo bowl!! Yum!! Love the server/waitress/cashier. She was super friendly and full of smiles in a busy fast pace environment.

HFJgXuaifkKu-_x7A0qnhw.text: GREAT FOOD AND SERVICE! My new fave Hawaiian spot. The poke is super fresh and perfectly seasoned. The kalbi had great flavor as well. The only thing I would say is there wasn't a thick enough piece in my spam musabi. There was a ton of rice and a very thin slice of spam. But regardless, it was good.  Definitely will come back and suggest it to others as well.

b2LIBAKbeMdyn_EiFDRreA.text: This place is laid out like a capriottis on the inside. Bar to order from and then a few high tables. First time there today and it was so good! I got bbq chicken which had really good flavoring. I upgraded to fried rice for $2 and it was so worth it. The flavoring was great for both items I had! Would have given it five stars but I had a few fatty pieces in my chicken that made me give it only four stars. The staff was friendly and nice to be around. It was excellent and I'll be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G3GrdJe3ZwK66j9KCYo-IQ.text: Wow!!! Amazing !!! Tried this place out for the first time and all I can say is why didn't I know this place existed. Ordered the chicken adobo and chicken furikake and both were so good. Very generous portions. We left that place with happy bellies. Will definitely be coming back soon.

Nv6PiLIUupOIgo1LXxDuiA.text: This is my favorite casual Hawaiian restaurant in town so far.   As soon as we walked in we were warmly greeted by the woman that was taking and delivering orders to customers. She showed us the specials and asked if we had any questions as we reviewed the menu, but she didn't rush us.   The inside of the restaurant only has about five tables, but is clean and organized. I definitely felt comfortable dining inside the restaurant.   I had the Mixed Plate with Kalbi Short Ribs & Furikake Shrimp. The Kalbi Short Ribs had great flavor, plenty of meat, and most pieces had more meat than fat. The slight char on each rib was perfect. The Furikake Shrimp had a the perfect amount of breading and the seasoning on the breading had a nice flavor. The white rice  was simple, but well prepared. The macaroni salad was so good! I loved the black pepper taste and the dressing on the macaroni.   My husband also had a Mixed Plate, but with Chicken Katsu and Kalua Pig & Cabbage. The Chicken Katsu was very tasty with tender chicken and the breading was tasty. The Kalua Pig & Cabbage also had great flavor with tender meat.  Of course I couldn't pass on a piece of Guava cake to take home. Guava is such an underused fruit and I love the guava in this cake. The cake has great flavor and is very moist.   Both meals had very generous portions of both meat and sides. I see why meals are served in to go containers after seeing the portions. We definitely had a decent amount of leftovers. I like that plastic bags are out to help with taking leftovers home. Prices are reasonable given the portions and quality.

rp-89mvjljl8Ymm9u2vm1w.text: I ate here for the first time tonight and I'm so happy I did! Island Grill (also on Eastern) is usually my go-to place for my Hawaiian food fix but I wanted to change things up and try something new.   I ordered their furikake chicken and a Hawaiian sun juice. I got a generous amount of chicken with two scoops of white rice (you can sub it for fried rice for $2 more) and mac salad. It kind of reminded me of Zippy's Korean chicken, which made me instantly nostalgic. The mac salad was really tasty and they give generous scoops of rice, which is great if you're serious about that meat to rice ratio, like I am!

aOOzG2fuoOW2wDf8y5x60Q.text: Hate to say it, but my next door local kine jam is losing stars. Tonight was the second time I've gotten mushy rice. Last time, I thought it was just because I ordered brown rice (which isn't really standard), but I got the house white tonight for good measure and proved myself wrong. Hawaiians don't do mushy rice...It's an everyday thing where I'm from. Maybe someone just isn't paying attention here. Little too much char on the kalbi too. Possibly just a super off day, but too many other good spots around the way to be doing it wrong.  Guava cake from the off-site bakery was good though.

syOQW7Y9Y116OKiKvpBQLQ.text: Best place in town for locals and best Hawaiian , best customer service  from kehaeu!!! She is amazing server.

zW1iLSQALxuRje5ekfjMyg.text: Best Short Ribs in Las Vegas!!!!!!!! Friendly customer service and great island atmosphere!

GxPJf4ogM8eVzx25t0osaA.text: Island Flavor is hands down my favorite spot for local food when I'm missing the flavors of my Hawai'i!   First of all, the portions are HUGE! I've learned after a couple visits with my family that I am not capable of finishing a plate by myself, so my sister and I always share. My favorite and what seems to be the most popular plate lunch is the Furikake Chicken. The chicken is crispy, moist, and so freaking full of flavor! I'm a creature of habit and tend to get this every time I go, but it's just too delicious to try something else! The poke is great too! The fish is cut into perfect sized cubes and it's always fresh. If you have room for dessert, they have a fridge in the corner full of different cakes... Haupia is to die for! Sometimes they even have fresh kulolo near the register that you can take to-go too! Yum!  Overall, the BEST place to go for local food in the Henderson area! Great food and even better service! The staff is awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi Short Ribs, Loco Moco (look at all that gravy), and Furikake Chicken

m7mOIAjMIZjHPnmpXFb96A.text: I used to love this place when I crave Hawaiian food, but things have changed. The mixed plate price went up I paid 16$ but the portions have gotten a lot smaller def not worth 16$. I won't be Back sadly... also , the furikake chicken was not the same not as crispy and lacked flavor. The Kalbi was burnt and almost all fat :(

tC7CTrATQqG9Aug_KwNYkQ.text: This place is amazing! Very nice vibe of Hawaii. Almost feels like a local restaurant back in the island. Staff was great and welcoming and the furikake chicken is a must try! One thing I want to definitely point out is the Kalbi Short ribs. If you're use to going to L&L, Aloha Kitchen, or #1 Hawaiian Barbecue, you're use to getting it for about 8 bucks. You'll notice here at Island Flavor that it's double, but man oh man when you get that Kalbi on your table and you open it up, you'll notice the difference. Very thick and just tender enough where you can easily bite and break it down as you chew. Juicy and the marinade they use just tastes so good. This is one of those occasions where paying more for Kalbi here compared to other spots that charge cheaper, is worth every dollar!

Rt-T5dCCusUxB3Ek8cKJ2Q.text: Awesome food... nice to order online to skip the wait. We love their fried rice and furokaki chicken

6oHDZZYHAF5Q0E4TpQLWNQ.text: Apparently I ordered a large plate of kalbi fatty ribs.    So much fat, 1 pc was all meat.  All the other 8 pieces were all fat.  The cooks are messed up for putting a dish like this together.

FsuGdF0qNXG7qU6nZ9j6Sg.text: Salty, meaty, and not a hint of pineapple, Truly Hawaiian comfort food.  Such a great spot for a quick bite, that way you can get back to instagramming food-stuffs and checking the Netflix library. I was doing all of the above while I waited for my food.   I went with Hamburger Steak, a 10 oz. patty broiled and topped with mushrooms, onions, and brown gravy. This is a tasty Hawaiian standard; the hamburger was juicy, the onions were still snappy and the brown sauce coated everything. This plate of food comes with house made macaroni salad, because what goes better with a heavy ass meal, than pasta covered in mayo.   You want classic, "Island Flavor" (ha, see what I did there?) this place has it spades, including Musubi, a seaweed snack with spam and rice. Nummers.   Mahola, Island Flavor. Mahalo.

DNzLyxRX9iVKJ-ezve3fbA.text: So these could very well be the best short ribs I've ever tasted. For my picky eater boys to devour them and then ask for more is the best sign of really really good food. We also had the Poke=delicious and the Furikake chicken=amazing. If I was to point one thing out is that your plate has way to much rice added for the 2 plate combo. So next time I'll ask for only 1 scoop of rice and problem solved. Staff was great and easily answered questions we had. Island flavor has become a staple for our family.

-UuOElodIUCNSpdEoJ_D-A.text: Furikake chicken and tinono pork belly is a winnah .  So much oxtail is in the oxtail soup.  AND Tex's famous malasadas is the best.  They even give you reheating instructions for the ones you take home.  Kim our server was the bestest of all.  Great experience, friendly staff, great Hawaiian food and music, not missing home at all.  And they open at 8 on Sat and Sun for breakfast.

kcfzLfp1fTSTDD5OCjffDg.text: We normally go to the Island Flavor on Durango. Wanted to try this one out.   Please take this as constructive criticism, and not a negative comment.  I ordered the Teri Beef with Stir fry, it was very tasty but the stir fry really didn't have much vegetables. Maybe putting a little more onions, some bell peppers and some mushrooms would bring it up to another level.  My wife got the Shrimp Scampi. We were not aware that it was shrimp with rice. we were expecting shrimp with pasta. Suggest letting customers know it doesn't come with pasta. Also the taste really wasn't there. I couldn't put my finger on on what was missing. but as a suggestion, maybe a little more garlic/butter and maybe with some olive oil and not cook as long as the shrimp was really overcooked.  We would like to come back and support local businesses from the 808 as that's where we moved here from.  Again, please take this comment as a positive way to possibly improve rather than a negative comment/complaint.

VhFxeh1QlGohYSVT9Z_YJw.text: Never had katsu chicken before and this was really good as was the teriyaki chicken. Not a fan of the fried shrimp but the other items were good enough to overlook that. Fried rice is great for a fast food place.

qTs-Gkw16nTMsKkr8kWW_Q.text: Awesome grinds....Da staff friendly and make u feel like Ohana...When u missing Hawaii jus come ova hea dey make u feel like home....Mahalo Nui....We Celebrated my daughters Birthday hea...

4I7MzwWV7WU0ZbOxThWRLA.text: The food was delicious and made up for the negative experience that had left a bad taste in my mouth.  1. Called Eastern location for order pick-up (called 5 different times. Phone rang and rang with no answer every time) 2. Called the Durango location for info on the eastern location as to why no answer. Girl who answered was polite and said "that location is very busy and never answers the phone" like it was a normal thing.  3. I make the 4 mile drive and find a whopping 1 party of four dining in with no line to order. 4. I asked the male cashier politely if they are taking orders by phone and he said yes. I said I had been trying to call a lot to place an order and he says " I'm the one who takes calls and I haven't heard the phone ring, so."  I said, you might want get the line checked out because I called many times with no answer. Crickets! Deaf ears! No reply, No apologies, he didn't bother checking the phone and walked away.  I only wanted to pick up and go because the kids were hungry and because of the distance. I arrived a little more than an hour before closing time. I saw the same cashier take down the specials of the day and the cook even asked him why! Maybe he turned off the ringer to avoid business because it was almost closing time.  Just saying.

XcOsiNCTpTHYSmG6DAvJrA.text: I got the a combo furikake chicken and Korean chicken.  The furikake chicken was pretty good but the Korean chicken was light on the sauce.  Also got he Kalbi ribs must be a different cook because it did not look like any of the other pictures posted it was burnt and dry; Most of it inedible .   The previous post noted 4 large pieces what I got was maybe 2 1/2 pieces if you put them altogether; the ribs were cut in smaller pieces.  The service was excellent  I just went again and ordered the Kallbi plate and furikake chicken.  This time I called my order in and this the Kalbi plate was a little better but the sauce was on the bottom of the box and the flavor was light on the Kalbi.  The furikake chicken was pretty good and a good portion.  Just went back again and finally got the Kalbi just right.  The reason I came back was the note I got from Bruce asking me to try it again.  The furikake chicken was consistent.   I notice the kitchen was more attentive on the preparation and execution of the food.  The previous visits the staff was lacking the attention the food needs to be presented at its best.  Well done on the Kalbi and I had Kalbi in numerous ways in South Korea; Suwon, Seoul, Bundang..etc. and this was comparable to ones I had in Suwon.

ojjsuXRgSuxyxHDeWiM5uQ.text: I was so excited to try Hawaiian food. I ordered what I thought was a hamburger. What I got was white rice and some meat SWIMMING in a pool of gravy with an egg floating on top. There was more gravy than anything else, it actually made me sick.

ZP22CrMwb6U-M_CoG4_stw.text: Visiting from SoCal. I absolutely love the Furikake chicken. It has great savory flavor. The amount of chicken I got was on point. Also, their poke is delicious! The staff was very friendly and made this an enjoyable experience.

mR2l9mCng7VV05fz_J38Dw.text: My favorite goto spot for Hawaiian food. Normally get the Mixed Plate with Furikake Chicken or Shrimp with the Kalbi ribs.  Love the fact that they serve brown rice too. yeCvTqCICGSLlU5JB4c69w.text: Great Big Island food.  I like the kali short ribs.  My kids love the Kalua pig with cabbage.  Great Hawaiian Loco moka.  Excellent service.  Call for take out. I lived in Kona for 12 years a d it is the best local food I have found.

MZo7YiDt2lwrXFtaTASisA.text: What a huge disappointment. Used to come here all the time and idk if management changed or what but it's not the same. Food quality is worse, barely any flavor, portions are smaller, and the prices are higher. Doesn't make sense how such a great establishment could fall so far. Dry Kalbi, gristly chicken, and the fried rice was pathetic. No aloha left in this place.

jTIsMwbZcU_ZnO3Du2KoVQ.text: We went to Island Flavor on  a Friday night but lucky for us we were right before the rush. We ordered he mixed plate of Kalbi steak and chicken with tossed salad. There were only 2 chefs and one runner so I recommend everyone to expect a long way for their food. However, I think the wait is well worth it. They served you the two entrees with two scoops of rice ( brown/jasmine) that could feed two people. The beef was tender and chicken was crispy. I am not an expert in Hawaiian foods but this place is a must try .

Gpb4FM6160_AO154C24aQg.text: The space is small with limited seating, looked like a lot of to go orders. The soda machine was broke and it felt like no AC today. The Mac salad had a good flavor but on the dry side. The kalbi had a good flavor and cooked with a little char. Teri chicken was good too but get the sauce on the side if you don't like thick and really sweet gravy type sauce. Korean chicken was ok...felt like it needed to be a bit more crispy. Kinda reminded me of local owned cafe on the island. No fluff or decor just da grindz brah.

BkFdbd1sC_US1qd2t4Gs5w.text: Island flavor is the best Hawaiian food place in town hands down! No comparison. Price is great compared to the amount of food you get, especially when you get a mixed plate with an upgrade to fried rice! Everything I've ordered has been great, but my favorites are the roast pork with gravy, chicken katsu with gravy, furikake chicken, teriyaki chicken, beef, and kalbi ribs (did I just list their whole menu?), even their stir-fried veggies.  When you do visit though, try and save room for desserts. Their cakes are sooooo delicious, especially the guava and the haupia (coconut) cake. The coconut cake is not too heavy coconut, which I love! Just try this place, you won't regret it!

H3sZ_wVWgyRNIL7mTezJQA.text: Maybe Monkey look at this all wrong. Who am I to expect new owners to carry on original owners and operators legacy?  It happens all the time in restaurant business. New owners come, change things to their own tune, because as owners, it is now their own. This was never Monkey's business. It was a favorite for sure. Monkey bring friends and families often when they came to visit, because we love to share the best things in life.   So, if new owners rather sell avocados decorated with poke, cut 1 Kalbi into 4 pieces or over marinate Teri beef, so be it. If social media is the key to running a restaurant, then why bother focusing on the food that former loyal customers crave?  Right?  Plenty new suckers with no taste come to Vegas everyday for the authentic hype.    Five Stars!  5 Whole stars for all your efforts, changes, deleting all criticism and JMPForce paid reviewers. Monkey give you 5 stars free of charge!  Monkey leave you alone. You've done enough damage yourself. Have yourself a Merry Christmas!  Just kidding.

bAd8ykc6CGrsIrc08ZpVjA.text: This is absolutely the best spot in town to get Loco moco. Well it was. Let me ask you guys why did you change the recipe? Did someone tell you it was to good so change it? Did changing the recipe to Coca Cola go well?   Rule 1.  When you make the best of something and everyone loves it DONT CHAMGE IT. PERIOD. THE BURGER IS NOWHERE LIKE IT WAS. Thank god the gravy wasn't changed. I'm sure you got somebody out of culinary school telling you spice is better or whatever the hell you put in the patty. Listen clearly. It's not at all. Not even close.   Bring back the original. Now. Before you lose $1000's of dollars. I promise you this is a mistake. If you don't believe me ask customers. Not chefs.

TIoaDJ4GWq1uIQtX74cnUg.text: This place is amazing. I've been to the regular island flavor restaurant, and this one is more a take out place but still has a few tables. I always order the same thing which is the furikake chicken! It's one of the best things on the menu.

b9X0vZ-oyJGrE5FbzrW00Q.text: This is a must try for tourists. Whenever we have people visiting from us, we take them here. I wish this place was bigger. Lots of the time, we just stand around to wait for the order. Food is made fresh to order, so it takes 15' on average to receive an order. I like to call ahead of time for pickup, but they often not pick up the phone during busy lunch and dinner time. Despite the long wait, lacks of waiting area, and how warm it usually is in here, this place gets 5 stars from me! All the workers are nice. They apologize for long wait time. They thank me for patience. They always have smiles on their faces. The food IS AMAZING. When in doubt, get chicken furikaki with fried rice. Fried rice always cooked to perfection. I like to order mine less salty. Macaroni salad comes as complimentary side, and it's also yummy.

9a8qlmkBDqpmLwe9UWecnA.text: I'm from Hawaii so I know wassap. The chicken katsu was standard. I love their furikake chicken and short ribs. I think it's the best island flavor style food in Vegas. My most favorite. But I have to drop a star ever since they raised prices on the ribs. My mix plate was $15 bucks. If 15 pesos then yeah, it's ok, but not $15 bucks. U5FFxWIHpSoWBk_dwMC1rA.text: There are so many Hawaiian restaurants in town, but this is hands down the best place. Definitely enough for 2 meals, and they make for good left overs.

cWkNNnTKfrRw1H424wW6Ww.text: The ambiance of Island Flavor Express was about what you can expect from an establishment with the word "Express" in it. The casual Hawaiian restaurant is a quiet hole-in-the-wall in a strip mall off the 215 and Eastern Ave. As soon as you walk in the door, you are engulfed in the distinct scent of steamed rice, grilling meat, and soy. The dining area, which is quite small, as they do mostly to-go and catering orders, is not much to look at. The tables, chairs, and flooring all look dilapidated and in need of repair or replacement, though everything is clean and organized. The environment is overall welcoming, as the manager personally greets each customer and seemed to immediately know when it was someone's first time (a sure sign of a loyal customer-base!).   Despite its humble appearance, the food was fantastic! The restaurant, both the dining and cooking areas, appeared clean. Though the kitchen was open to the dining area, there was not too much kitchen noise that it disrupted conversation. Besides the great food, the aroma is the next best thing I remember after walking in - the perfect combination of sweet and salty married with delicious grilled meats. I was also astonished at the portion that is served in one of their platters, which costs just $9. Not only does the meat of your choice come with two sides, but it comes with enough meat to easily feed two to three people. It was a fantastic value!  Not only was the food excellent, but the service was decent as well. Both the service staff and the kitchen staff had good attitudes and greeted people as they entered. The manager, who was serving as well, was very warm and attentive. The service was both authentic and efficient, and the staff all appeared tidy and well-groomed. The restaurant did seem well-staffed, as there was little wait time, though it was not very busy when I was there, and with increased volume, additional servers may be a good idea to keep up with their service standards.  Overall, I was very pleased with the food & service I experienced here.

RQSpdmWN9rRVQqtX5Lg_HQ.text: Best Hawaiian food in Vegas! The hardest part is trying to decide what to order because it's all delicious. Great service and sometimes they even have live music.

kpMS39nyKpkZN8cmTDV8Gw.text: This place was fantastic. I will def be back! Got the Hawaiin poke the 1/2 size and it was actually a lot! Got the plate with Teri chicken and short ribs! Came with white rice but you have the option to substitute and got the macaroni salad!

eHKeCdP39aKMa4vfsTnYoA.text: Two words: Furikake Chicken!!! This is BOMB.com. Your tastebuds will thank you and then you can thank me for saving you some time from wondering what to order. No seriously! Ok, ok the pork roast is good too but don't order the oxtail soup...if you're thinking oxtail soup from California Hotel, not even close! You can go to California Hotel for their oxtail because they do have the best soup in town! Overall, best Hawaiian food that I can get in my side of town other than Island Sushi.

hFK_6L6mniGrCQ3XMe93yA.text: I haven't written a review in awhile...but, I felt obligated after trying Island Flavor for the first time. Located right off the 215 and Eastern in the Regal Plaza, right next to the PT's (the old Roadrunner bar, for those who remember that place). I had heard good things about this Hawaiian (excuse me, big island) style plate lunch spot. I had the day off, so I thought I would give it go...  First off, very small place, maybe 5 bistro style table seating to one side and the kitchen on the other side. Love the Hawaiian/Reggae music selection playing ( does anyone still call it Jahwaiian?). Decor is what you would expect, pictures of Hawaiian flowers and foliage and a representation of all the islands on the wall...but, hey, not here for decor, here for the foods.  They have a small specialized menu and daily specials board (all sounded good to me...), but I opted for the mix plate w/ the Furikake Chicken everyone's raving about and Roast Pork with gravy ($11.25). Ordered to go...when the chef called my name and handed me my plate lunch bagged up, he gave me one of those "what's up bruddah" chin nods. Like he knew what deliciousness I was in store for. I grabbed for my bag of food, and I swear the thing weighed like at least 5 lbs.! He noticed the surprised look on my face and smiled, I mustered a "thanks bruddah" and headed home.  In anticipation, I popped open my styrofoam container and...boom! Huge, I mean, HUGE portion of the chicken ( I think I might've actually gasped). For the unbelievers, see photo... Now I know what all the hype was about, the Furikake Chicken was super ono. Crunchy fried chicken nuggets of love, rolled in a honey sweet sauce and salty seaweed,bonito flakes with sesame seeds...sweet and savory, how I likes it. If I had to reminisce, I would say it kinda reminded me of the "Tasty" Chicken they serve at the Alley in the Aiea Bowl in Hawaii ( if you're from Aiea, you know what I'm talking about). The Roast Pork was tender and juicy, it just fell apart as I dug into it. Good gravy! The gravy was good...and the Mac salad was legit. I think there was an audible "oh my god this is good!" As I was nom-nomming away.  So, yeah...that happened. So delicious, but couldn't finish it...leftovers, yay! Island Flavor, thumbs up and shakas!!! will definitely be back, maybe give it the fifth star

KTbLuy8GJ0Yk_NPYYc0xOw.text: Big flavor. Big portions. Head to Island Flavor Express!  People who lived in Hawaii are blessed that Vegas is the 9th island. You don't have to go far to get some Island grinds. The newest addition to Henderson is located in the shopping area on Eastern Ave & Pebble.   Same owners as Island Flavor on Durango, they are a casual place-order/pick-up order or take-out service style restaurant. The staff has been incredibly friendly on each visit and the place is clean and simple, with about 6 tables inside.   Food I've ordered:  Furikake Ahi Poke Hawaiian-Style Poke Kalbi Ribs Furikake Chicken & Shrimp  Furikake Chicken - Let's cut to the chase. I don't even eat chicken. The batter and glaze they use is insane, I couldn't help but try a few pieces that were just crumb batter. OMG. Sweet and salty deliciousness! My boyfriend and toddler loved it, too. I tried the shrimp version, and they over-fried it, so I wasn't as happy with it.   Poke - The portion they give are great. The fish is cubed into good sizes. However, I can't say it's the best I've had. The fish tastes good, but I prefer the poke to have been marinated longer. Melt-in-your-mouth kind of poke...  Kalbi - Ridiculous portion and the meat is tender! Look at the posted pictures below.  Desserts - They have a rotating selection found in the fridge by the door, so you can self-serve and take it to the counter. I have yet to try any, but I've seen Chantilly, Haupia, Guava Chiffon, and Coco Puffs. They also stock Hawaiian Sun canned drinks.  Look at their chalkboard for their daily specials. They serve Lau Lau on Fridays and I've seen Mahi Mahi and Kalua Pig posted, too.  This has become one of those regular stops I'll make when I want some quick but tasty Hawaiian eats for the family. I'd love it if they could start serving oxtail soup and malasadas! That's the only thing I can say they are missing. But I'd highly recommend stopping by if you're hungry in Hendertucky!

LakAxbb5crCDayPTmZn3hA.text: Of course...the food was AMAZING. Large portions of traditional yet unique foods. We've tried their spicy ahi avocado poke, furikake chicken, pork roast, and pork dumplings. I have NO complaints.  The ahi was cut in good sized cubes and was so firm and fresh. The furikake chicken is the perfect sweet and salty and crunchy combo. The pork roast was perfection.  Not to mention the service was great. It seemed like all waitresses checked on all tables whether they were in their zones or not. Lots of Aloha in this place. Keep it up guys!

9bIro1h-suEaCaCqjlLCAA.text: This place is absolutely amazing. If you like Hawaiian food and style cooking, this place is a must stop!  I usually make this my once a week Sunday hit-up. I'm always craving Hawaiian Barbecue.  This place does not disappoint.  My only gripe is that the Henderson location closes early on Sundays.  I believe they close at 4PM on Sundays.  My favorite dishes are the Chicken Katsu with the katsu sauce, Golbi beef, and the Furikaki Chicken. Comes with white rice and macaroni salad.  You can opt for the fried rice which is also really good.  The Furikaki Chicken is the star here.  I've only ever had chicken like this served at a Thai restaurant in Hawaii.  Tastes very similar to Korean style chicken. I'm not really sure whats in this or how they make it.  But this dish is heavenly.  I usually order two because it's sooooooo good.  Definitely check this place out!

I messaged the business, and they apologized and let me know I could come in within 10 days and get a salad on them, done the way I want. They honored it without any hassle and provided me with the proper cook on the ahi.    In addition to that I found I really enjoy their furikake chicken.  My friend had ordered it and let me try and it wasn't overly salted like some reviews had said.  It was addictive really. The food was ready in less than 10 min.... got home & found out that was too quick considering my kalbi ribs were extremely rare & fatty (Maybe they're supposed to be that way? -idk, pics attached) the other down side was that I ordered fried rice & received white rice (yes, there was an up charge so I call about it tomorrow -I called 3x when I got home & got the busy signal every time) & lastly they were out of desserts which sucks but completely understandable! Will I try again? Definitely. (will update review) Total: 18$ (combo plate & soda) Tip: Check your order b4 u leave (even if it's tied & ready to go), order Furikake chicken!!, specify how well you'd like your meat cooked (I love rare steaks but rare kalbi? She's amazing at multi-tasking and is unstoppable. This location is crazy busy! The foot traffic alone was a tell tale sign this place is legit. Pork belly had 7 small cut pieces mixed into a whole red onion and a bunch of tomatoes. Not worth the money.   1 star for the good customer service. In the end, however, it's a restaurant and the food has to be good. It's not. It feels like management was trying to save money by cutting down on quality. I still can't figure out the adobo. I understand some whole peppercorns, but over 100 in 1 serving just makes it inedible.

I also don't care for how they serve everything in styrofoam, which is terrible for the environment.   I had one amazing order of the furikake chicken, and came back months later to a version that was overly thick with dry meat inside. The poke hasn't steered me wrong but it's not my top choice to get it. The musubi has been disappointing as well, but their mac salad is one of my favorites. Seems to be kind of hit or miss depending on the day. Props for allowing some substitutions!

94iG_hh_08U7jFke0ZxiSA.text: If there's a plate that you should order here at Island Flavor, it should be the Furikake Chicken. It's one of their unique items on the menu, and it's pure comfort food. If you think orange chicken is good, furikake chicken is it's better-tasting cousin.   Right from the start, your eyes are slapped with a huge portion of beautifully glazed nugget-sized chicken pieces, garnished with a generous amount of sesame seeds and minced scallions.   It doesn't just look good. Unsurprisingly, it tastes good, too. The slight crunchiness and glaze give it a nice texture, the chicken pretty tender, and the taste. Oh, the taste is so flavorful without being overwhelming. Perfect for those two scoops of rice you'll be pairing the chicken with.   The plate is also accompanied by a tasty macaroni salad. It's rich and creamy, and you know, it's just good. Nothing more to say here.   I got two meals out of this baby, so it was well worth the great price.

-kL_QXH8fyV9hnpKHndGBw.text: The food here is outta control.  The Mac salad is seasoned just right, not too much mayo but just enough.  The rice is tender and warm, as it should be but isn't always the case at other spots. I ordered their furikake chicken.  That was so bomb. I haven't had that before. So, that was a nice change. The flavor of the furikake really shined through and paired with rice in each bite, it was a great balance of flavor between the taste of the chicken protein, the furikake and the sauce on the food. I can't even begin to tell you how massive the adobo friend rice was too. I was not expecting anything as huge as what we got. My husband and I picked up food from here before heading to the airport. I didn't think that we'd have any trouble finishing our food but boy, we ended up consolidating both our left overs into a single take out box and well, we still had enough food for someone to enjoy a complete meal.  Their portions are large and their prices are just right for us, under $10 per plate, with the exception of an item or two depending on whether it's a special or if it's fish/seafood.  The folks who work here are friendly and witty. They're chatty but not overly so. I'd love to come back and try more things. They accept cards, thankfully. I tipped them in cash. I just don't think that you could go wrong eating here. Yum!

pLiyzAsrT_VXy2_q3JBsVA.text: I finally got to try this place out! I had to order food to pick-up before work, but I still got to try it! So yeah... I ordered through eat24 for pick-up. I'll just save that for tonight's dinner XD Anyway... I was seriously liking the flavors of the food once I had the time to chow down! Customer service was awesome too, and I only stayed for like 5 minutes at the most. The nice cashier greeted me once I got in, and figured it was my to-go order, which she was right about. I think it was all about the demeanor, and I miss hearing the friendly Hawaiian pigeon accent.  The bonus point for me is that the place is near home! Score!
