vSb6qK-dMEywZq0e2O-bCw.text: So, I get off work around 8:30 and love Hawaiian food afterwards and this place pop up to close at 9pm. I called and ordered and the person on the phone  told me the order will be ready and be reminded that they close at 9. When I got there 8:57 I expected my order to still be there since they said they close at 9pm. I see people are still eating inside when I get there so I knocked since the doors are locked up. The workers were just looking at me and wouldn't open the door, so then a guy finally came out at 9:02 and said all the orders were thrown out at 8:57. I was hoping for a decent notification when I called that the food will be thrown out at a certain time so I didn't have to drive there and wasted my time. Not coming here or will recommend this particular location to anyone due to this experience.   Thank you anyways and good luck.

vbhGPI_uDx_Y0Vm66f34MA.text: Now this is some serious Hawaiian food. zUIRS0jdjtM87Ull5cWfbA.text: I really enjoyed Island Flavor's other location and was glad they opened another location on this side of town. Know for their larger portions this location didn't disappoint!  I stopped in for my favorite mixed plate of Kalbi ribs and Furiake Chicken and added Fried Rice instead of the white rice and its served with mac salad. y3eNqQdzk30wveXb2i2HWQ.text: This place is so ono and definitely worth the trip from downtown/the strip. The restaurant itself is pretty small with only a few tables to sit at, but thankfully a large party had just left once we got there.   There were so many good local food options on the menu I had a hard time deciding what to get. Ended up ordering the furikake chicken and Kalbi mixed plate. The portions were HUGE and came with a side of mac salad. So glad I decided to share it because there was no way I was going to be able to finish it. The furikake chicken was my favorite out of the two, but I think the mixed plate is definitely the way to go if you want to try other things without having to order two separate dishes.   There were so many other things I wish I could have tried-- the loco moco, kalua pig, poke etc. Guess I just have to come back to Vegas next weekend, shucks.

pjocXeMgL0qbIawN444EBA.text: After a hard day there is nothing better than stuffing your face with fatty and salty hot food with a dash of acidity, change my mind.   Interestingly Island Flavor separates itself from the mass of generic L&L copy cats by doing their own style and makes plate lunches that don't look so boring fluffed up with cabbage. This location is a much smaller version of the Durango location but serves up food quick to get you on your way with a few tables for sit down (if you're lucky, its alwayssss full). This location also serves bento boxes ready to go that are sitting cozy under the heat lamp with everything necessary for a very hearty meal.   Favorites will always be the furikake chicken, loco moco, and the roast pork!

zxNUkE75_3CIW-gCK-51qA.text: If you knew the old island flavor you would know this isn't anything close to what it used to be.   Ordered loco moco the patty was super  hard/dry and over seasons with what tasted like Italian sausage which was gross. It's lost the Hawaii mentality of cooking with just getting by it's a hit or miss with this. So sad on to the next local spot.

zuYepD0y5PjsQvAiJ6QFhw.text: Food is great, policy sucks.  As stated, nothing but good things from this place except for one thing which is for take out orders.  Apparently when you have to do phone orders, they have to take your card info over the phone. When I initially placed a call around 4:11pm, kindly I asked the person on the line if they could make my order and that I am already on my way. Since it takes about 20mins drive from my house, I just wanted to come by and pick it up. With the Vegas heat, I didnt want to turn off my car and order when I get to the place and wait another 10mins or so.   He declined and stated per company policy they have to get paid before picking up. Though my order was only $16+ I understand if its more than $50 it would be reasonable. Anyhow I still came and bought my food, just a little disappointed about that take out policy. Placed my order at 4:25pm, was out in 12mins or so.

p9HX4KQNj1QpUpa9MmQ-CA.text: Island flavor is definitely one of the best Hawaiian food places in Vegas. I forgot her name but the cashier that is always there taking orders is so friendly makes you feel like you're at home. Since this place is express, it is a little smaller with limited seating area. About 6 or 7  tables if I could recall. It does get busy around lunch time so try to beat the lunch rush or come after the rush.  The food portions here are huge. I wish they had 2 sizes. You can order one plate and share with 2 people and still be full.   My go to meal here is the furikake chicken. It's kind of like a Hawaiian version of orange chicken but not orange chicken. I guarantee this place is worth coming to just for that plate. I always sub the Mac salad for sauteed veggies.

XOe-ubl_7nT_AlR-Us17BQ.text: If you go to island flavor, you'll never leave hungry. Their portions are generous and they have all the typical feel good Hawaiian comfort foods you could want. They have several different flavors/styles of (tuna) poke that they can mix up for you right then and there. You can buy as little as half lb (see my photo). One thing that I thought was kind of cool that I haven't really seen anywhere else is that you can order your poke fried. I haven't tried it yet, but what doesn't taste good fried, right?  The meat plates come with a couple scoops of rice and some mac salad to go with it.  The cuts of katsu and kalbi are always generous. If I had any feedback to give this restaurant, it's that their foods are a little on the salty side (for me, and compared to some other Hawaiian restaurants) but otherwise delicious.  If you're ever in the area and want some quick casual Hawaiian comfort food, give this place a try.

JjDv2x1o9a6SfpZzhcrgwQ.text: 2018 update. Been a while since we ate here. Slight improvement from last year. They're going thru major changes at this location too. So right now the dining area is a hot mess.  Menu board was taken down, so you can't figure out what to order while waiting in line since menu and specials are up front with cashier, which is inefficient.   Passed up on Kalbi cause still not convinced, even after seeing the fancied up enhanced pix on IG. Plus can't justify paying 16 to 17 for a lunch plate at a fast /casual style restaurant. For few dollars more AYCE kbbq  or the lunch plate at Jun's across the way, for Kalbi is the way to go.   The Beef Stew special was good, but not as ono as Ross J's. which always sells out. Mr B liked their Loco Moco with Chicken Katsu Chicken. The portions are plenty for these dishes and pretty inexpensive.   Still something else is missin, ohana?, aloha? Just thankful there are other ono grindz nearby for me to get Kalbi plates.

iYZ2yteDoCUMST8uU_A5LA.text: Went here last week with my boyfriend and his family but to the Durango location. I got 1/2 lb of sesame poke at the time. Let me just say for 1/2 lb of poke for $10, it's such a good deal!!! The amount they give you and the size of each piece of tuna is awesome!!! They are also consistent with how it's made. I was hoping coming to this location it would be exactly the same as the Durango location and it was! The flavor is so good that you can't even taste that fishy tuna taste. I don't even like tuna that much but love the tuna they make here. They marinate the tuna so well and always tastes fresh. I recommend you trying it.  For a 1/2 lb of spicy avocado, sesame poke and  two spam masubi with two fountain drinks cost us $32! Such a great and filling deal!!!!

While enjoying Spring break in Vegas, my boyfriend naturally wanted his plate lunch fix... so we went and found this little gem.   I got the half pound Hawaiian poke and he got the furikake chicken with kalbi short ribs. My half pound was so generous, I felt like it was actually half a pound. Not like other places, where they're super cheap with their fish and give you like 8 small pieces. It was beautifully tossed with onions, shoyu, and green onions. So good. They both came with rice and mac salad. We were very impressed.   Finished both of our plates, happily!

D8DcMBLgX-A-gkS4mMhUeg.text: I love to hit up local establishments when visiting from out of town.  The family was craving Hawaiian food for one of our dinners.  Although there was an L&L close to our resort, I'm glad we took the little trek to this place.  Yelp recommendations did not disappoint.  We ordered 3 dishes and spam musubi and it was enough food to feed this family of 5.  We tried the chicken katsu, beef teriyaki steak, and furikake chicken (based on reading other yelp reviews). Never had furikake chicken before, but it was delicious.  A much better and tastier version of an orange chicken.  The beef in the beef teriyaki steak were nice good chunks and very tasty.  Just taking 1 star off because of the chicken katsu.  This was our least favorite of our dishes. It didn't taste like it was cooked to order.    The place is pretty small, with only 5-6 tables for dine it, but while we were waiting for our to-go order, it looks like most people do take out at this establisment.    Will definitely be visiting again next time I'm in Vegas.

5VCv5x5MJGLADYW-rL5qlw.text: Decided to come check out this little Island Flavor Express right by the movie theater I'm going to. It does have some seating but it's definitely not as spacious as the main restaurant since it's an express but it's good enough! Ordered the Kalbi ribs and Chicken Katsu combo with Mac and rice. The portion was plenty and the food was tasty, as usual. I'll be back whenever I'm in the neighborhood :)

sZcVhlZi393NTpsZbRyIJQ.text: Allllllllllright chy'all... I've finally overcame my mini food coma from dinner earlier tonight. My verdict is IN, &Island Flavor is packed with flaaaaaaava flaaaa! I've seriously found my new favorite Hawaiian Fusion spot out here in Henderson!  *wink If you haven't tried Island Flavor what are you seriously waiting for?! Seriously!   After ordering my takeout order via Yelp, I arrived early and was able to small talk with the workers. Island Flavor is a family ran restaurant and is one of its kind! As soon as I walked in, my nose was mesmerized, it's smelt SO delicious - I wanted to lick the walls! The open-style kitchen is brilliant because the smell from everything being cooked immerses the entire restaurant! After 'bout 10 minutes my food was ready. I'm surprised I didn't get a speeding ticket driving home because the smell from my take out bag was driving me nuts- it smelt THAT good, I couldn't wait to get home!  I ordered the mixed plate; my combination included the fruikake chicken and kalbi beef short ribs. I opted to try the fried rice instead of steam rice. After upgrading to the kalbi short ribs (+$3 extra) and the fried rice (+$2 extra), my dinner was totally worth it! Peep my pictures y'all, they don't even do it justice! The chicken had such a nice crunchy texture with a sweet and savory glaze sauce, SO good! The fried rice was bursting with flavor with chunks of pork slices &The Kalbi Beef short ribs, delicious, duh.   At the end of the day, I didn't feel guilty after spending almost $15 for a mixed dinner plate. I barely finished half, so in my eyes I'm getting two meals out of one. That's winning in my book!

uV2mOOiFZDsuWyu6Le64WA.text: Vegas is called the ninth Hawaiian island for a reason - so. much. good. Hawaiian food, and Island Flavor has to be one of the best! The restaurant is more of a take out shop, but there are enough tables/chairs that you'll be able to eat in if you choose.  Furikake chicken: Imagine orange chicken, but better. The quality of rice here is always a lot better than the other restaurants I go to. The rice is a little closer to the moist flavorful Japanese rice than that dry white stuff they call rice here in America. The macaroni salad is GOOD. I hate to admit it but since Macaroni salad is the one thing you always get at every Hawaiian restaurant, it plays a big part in how I rank my Hawaiian restaurants. The macaroni salad here does not disappoint. Super creamy, super thick, just how I like it.  Spam musubi: The one here at Island Flavor has furikake in it instead of the usual brown sauce. If you're expecting the sweet sauce flavor that spam musubi usually has, you might be a little disappointed in the one here.  Katsu chicken: Super thick pieces of katsu! the breading to chicken ratio has to perfect and Island Flavor really gets it down.

tQD353m4Ng_kQZLNgeZHIA.text: Updated review : I absolutely love this place but lately I can't even seem to call in an order , this has been going on for months now.. You call and call and call.. It will either ring for 5 minutes and go to some weird answering machine or you will get a busy signal "user busy" this happened 2 days ago. I'm driving home from work, decide to stop at the gas station and make a call to island flavor so I could pick up my order and it would be ready by the time I got there.. After 10 minutes of failed call attempts.. I walk into the restaurant and only one customer inside.. Not SO busy they couldn't answer the phone.   Literally the best Hawaiian food in vegas. I always get the Teri beef, my gf gets the kalbi ribs. They use the most quality meat I've ever tasted at any Hawaiian BBQ place. The Teri beef plate is like a giant steak cut up into thick cutlets. It's enough for 2 meals. One now and one later :D  The macaroni salad is probably my favorite part, it's ridiculously flavorful. I recommend island flavor to every single one of my friends and every tourist I meet that loves Hawaiian food. My tip to anyone ordering : call in your order to save some time waiting for food.

1cQrRxcWOE1FdJNsDXtpew.text: Great flavor! The customer service is amazing, so friendly and sweet. The food is authentic, truly takes me back to the islands. My go to dishes are the loco moco, furikake chicken and the salad dressing is heavenly.

nUo-HHowFSG8Csy9KKquig.text: Love this place. The food is always so ono, the portions are big. Besides great food Isaiah is my favorite always so friendly outstanding customer service. He always greets me with Aloha Aunty. Feels like I'm back home. All of the employees are great.

x3rzzsx8opEGZI8fbOG-DQ.text: By far the best island food I have had since being in HI... also this take out location is way better than their sit down one. Not sure why but it is. The staff here is much better as well.   I recommend the Furikake ckn or hamburger steak. Their best 2 dishes.

J77Iz-WQ6ERzTx7-fPI7Mw.text: Winnah winnah furikake chicken dinnah!  Love this place!  Food is top notch. Furikake chicken is awesome!  True Hawaiian food flavors!  Everything is delicious!

3fwXgNWSF-fqf-v2utKtlA.text: "Order for us and speak the funny way you Hawaii people do" says all my poker buds who have been to the islands.  "Funny way?  OK" my answer.  "May I help you" asks the cashier.  "Yes, and good afternoon.  May I please order..." wisea$$es.  The Hawaiian plate lunch.  Double carbs (two scoops rice, one scoop mac salad), loads of protein doused in gravy or coated in sticky, sweet teriyaki sauce.  2,000+ kcal, and two days of saturated fat.  I know I'm gonna catch heat from da bruddahs back home, but plate lunch here is better than almost any in Hawaii if you excuse the strange "mainland" menu items ie French fries or sauteed veg sub for rice.  Eater Vegas calls it Hawaiian BBQ.  Deeply marinated untrimmed, fatty, shortribs in a soy, sugar, ginger concoction, grilled and served on the bone.   Sweet, juicy, fatty; the burnt bits adding character, pulling the uber flavorful membrane from the bone and chewing it like a dog chews a rawhide, an added bonus.  Their furikake chicken, deep fried nuggets of chicken, heavily coated in flour and doused in a sticky sweet teriyaki sauce with laver and sesame seeds good eats.  Some overcooked, dry and chewy (da sauce taste better on those), larger nuggets moist and juicy.  Solid loco moco and hamburger steak with pan gravy.  Good beef stew made with fatty chunks of well braised beef (not dry and stringy). Huge spam musubi.  Pass  on the katsu, poke (previously frozen fish), fried shrimp, and teriyaki chicken (doused in sauce after being cooked).  Friendly counter service.  Inexpensive with most plate lunches $9 - $10.  That's it.  Time fo grind!

-_1Dh4Pa9sq78d53JvCgBw.text: Perfect place. We came to this place following Yelp in the first time, but we love the food here, then we took our friends to this place again. Fresh fits material, good taste, good price... Definitely will go there again.

PCMsPLtWIcZFrZduPS-0GA.text: Best Island style in Las Vegas! Healthy portions for sure! It you're looking for hearty beef stew-it's available as a special in Sat/Sun only and outs Grammy's to shame!

4FXN6mekLwCet8x-z0OLTQ.text: portions are big ! each meat comes with 2 scoops of rice and a side so be careful not to over order.   1.  Chicken Katsu $9 was average nothing amazing   2.  furikake chicken $9.50 was probably their best item we tried it was fried perfectly and sort of sweet also   3.  Kalbi short ribs $ 11.50 which tasted just like normal short ribs   4.  Korean chicken $9 was not worth it and way too salthy.   avoid this item   otherwise service was good not the fastest still takes about 15 minutes especially when it's busy.   other than a good pit stop prior to continuing your other part of the trip if your going east and avoiding the strip.

vXkqneL1L9mO6uK4dWKYHw.text: Yiiiiikes!!  I don't think we will be back here. Since the new owner took over , the prices went up ! A Kalbi / furikake chicken plate and a drink alone , cost my bf $21 !!! She seems greedy. Keep up with the prices I don't think this business will be getting the business they always had before.

AELIzFivw1BvHZcU2FCJRw.text: Our food was so ONO! And our server was kind enough to answer our questions. We definitely will come back again for more furikake chicken and kalbi plates

nFVAQarD1kivKiKQtLTb_g.text: If I'm looking for quick, casual, affordable and delicious this is definitely my go to restaurant. My family always order the furikake chicken and shrimps (if it's your first time you must order one of these two or both) they are just so delicious. We had their chicken katsu which is always perfectly crispy but chicken stays moist, Kalvin Ribs is also a must, Hawaiian style roast pork is also amazing and the fried rice omelette. One of these days we will try the other food on the menu but, it's always hard not to order what we already liked.

i_hQqCiOmNL7_qoawk_Rnw.text: NOM NOM NOM! This place is great! I stick to the furikake chicken because it's just THAT good, but I've had a few other things that were tasty too. The furikake is just my go to here. I've never been let down by it. Aside from the perfectly crisp furikake covered chicken, is their holy grail... que the drum roll... the mac salad. -Insert moment of silence here- YES! it is that good! It's amazing! I can't even begin to explain. I could literally eat a tub of this with no regrets. The food is just really good, freshly made, and super yummy! The staff is always super nice, and speedy! I wish there was one closer to my house.. I'd probably ask them for a job and accept furikake chicken as payment. No joke. Getchu' some!

hPl5gdCuNuPL3Hk1B8fFqw.text: I was raised in the 808 and this is a piece of home in the desert.  Their Ahi Bowls are second to none.(Hawaiian Style or Avocado Sauce!)  Our kids love it too. Teriyaki Chicken and Beef plate is enough for both of them and I can pick at it too.  The staff is friendly and you can't beat the quality of their food.

NCz4_2tdHpcnbb8nL8-m2g.text: absolutely horrible the way the mgr aka owner treats their employees!!!! so disrespectful and i will never go back!!! this needs to be owned again by the original owner!!!!  hawaiians only!!!

5aQhhuC5YpDNRJTMC2CzfQ.text: The food is delicious but the service is terrible. Just beware when you go in you will have a rude cashier who doesn't care about doing his job.

oM5ZAOeUlYBjvkpzJWgI6Q.text: Legit. Best plate lunch in Vegas and they give choke food.    Furikake chicken is awesome. Kulolo is on point. Hamburger steak was ono too.  They also have guava chiffon and chantilly cake slices in a fridge to grab.  This place is a must stop for me whenever I'm in Vegas.  Don't miss out!

E1Da31INUAaY6RDuylWXUg.text: Where has this been place all of my life?! That Furikake glazed chicken is to DIE for. The staff is super friendly however the location is small. We went around 1230pm and the place was pretty packed with people. Glad we called our order ahead of time or else we would've spent our whole lunch hour probably waiting. The place seems like it's family owned and you can see everything out in the open. From the spices they use on the top shelf to the chicken that comes out of the fridge before it gets fried. Pretty cool. Your plates will come standard with 2 scoops of rice and Mac salad. I wish they opened one close to home!

4pnxz6yiDFjxTR6V20zZwA.text: The other location tastes better. The food we order was average at most. Maybe I came in on a off day?

Y2wrqiInAt1Q5hORbskdNw.text: As I knew this place by Yelp and it seems to be high reputation, I've got to try some furikake chicken, Kalbi beef, and poke ahi tuna. To be honest, the food didn't taste that great to me. Kalbi was dried and hard to bite and I wanted to point out that the Poke tuna wasn't fresh and even didn't taste enough as the sauce was too light.

zE-t3KFlyjhfy03x73AQPQ.text: My food was delicious!  I got the teriyaki beef and was beyond thrilled. Ton of food. Wish we lived here so I could try more of the menu. Next time in Vegas for sure.

J1dUlhMOCDgB0WSaGYiqow.text: My FAVORITE place to eat at when I'm in Sin City. So glad they've got this new spot. Furukaki Chicken is my go to dish, and the portions are ample enough to satisfy this island girl and her Samoan husband. Different types of poke and desserts. I've never made a trip Vegas without stopping here for some good local food.

e2vJP_0MM49MXgXW1CaSSA.text: Really sad, but not as good as they use to be. Something is not right and losing consistent following. Not sure if kitchen staff changed or price cuts happened for food which entails lower quality. Hope this gets fixed I use to love this place.

7X6d3DRQnOHTNDGsCgKaYQ.text: Not many places make me come back as often as this location, the furikake chicken is so good.

gjOmhFfgQTXUy8053LenKQ.text: Fantastic food came into town for the weekend and had to stop by. Beef teriyaki steak is to die for.

9KMUAMzk7XWKA3Ef514S-A.text: One of our new favorite spots. Furikake chicken is amazing along with the short ribs. Musubi is a must also.

97KW8MFA4W7rPfaNkqfmaA.text: This is a nice place to eat off of the strip for some very good chicken and short ribs, very friendly staff. I will definitely be back again soon.

fBaC97BpRaXE3q9cCPDjLg.text: It was a weird night blaze pizza had a line out the door five guys ran out of hamburger buns and I just started driving in circles and found this place so I was not in the best of moods and I ordered it to go it's not like Hawaiian restaurants/chains around town have really thrilled me but it was packeand had awesome reviews so far  The staff  were very friendly pointing to the specials on the board which look interesting like a mahi-mahi  but I have my mind set on the short ribs and I got the teriyaki chicken 2 item combo basically for $12.50 I got three of the better tasting and thick Short ribs I've ever had and some very tasty teriyaki chicken and rice along with some macaroni salad  Everything was delicious very hard for me to give any restaurant like this a five star, but at this place stays consistent l,  it might make it there  So I went back for lunch and even better, the short ribs and furikake (sp?) chicken, wow now 5 stars  And the 3rd time now is just as tasty!!! Go-go-go

vtp2Fet3fRnlSPu2AeLowA.text: Love this place. Best local food I had so far since the 5+ years I lived in Vegas!!! Furikaki chicken is a must and don't forget the dessert. Hubby had the loco moco. It's so huge and so good. Love a ISLAND FLAVOR!!!

NptKUUSBFXr8jj95hY4nmA.text: Food always good and staff always friendly. We come for lunch and dinner and always leave happy.  Come hungry.. Poke plate is my usual but when the lau lau is the daily special that's the hot pick. Kim Chi fried rice and Korean chicken is Ono. Too much to name..

JAY0t_6uuwxaePZ2QsSACA.text: Great Hawaiian food for Las Vegas. Prices are a bit high for plate lunch but the portions are hefty. I definitely recommend this place!

xOrJcmg3pjbAX61FagV2aQ.text: This is actually Island Flavor Express, and it is just as good as its big brother Island Flavor on Durango. My husband and I were so exited to see their menu and try it out (we are huge fans of the other location) we grabbed an order of furikake chicken to take home on our way back from lunch. That is how good it is. The furikake chicken was done perfectly, crunchy on the outside, moist and flavorful on the inside, lots of good sauce. The mac salad was awesome too. Nice and creamy with just the perfect amount of dressing. We will be back to get all of our favorites, fried poke salad, loco moco, fried rice omelet. I may have to pick up jogging as a hobby now that this wonderful food is much closer to our home.

eLoiLiZlvFpsSG0RQqN7aQ.text: I want to THANK Island Flavor Express for being so yummy as I remembered. Thanks guys for such great real food and professionalism. Drake

ZlytHu6_sdYACFpC8Qk1XA.text: Island Flavor is a mostly-take-out based Hawaii food place.  There are a few tables but during the popular hours it is hard to find a seat.  The food is quite good.  For the price, it is a good amount of food.  Have tried the teriyaki chicken which was pretty good.  The poke have large chunks of fish which is generous.  Though my favorite is probably the guava cake.  Will continue to come back!

A6QJcK7NYTU9u-5bjjiv-g.text: Island flavor express just as good as the original island flavor! I love the Kalbi Ribs always my go to. If you think aloha kitchen and l&l is good wait till you try this place you'll never wanna get Hawaii food anywhere else! The service is good and the food is even better. Make sure to visit both locations.

F1r3LTzdnIb8uWNdWAOEbg.text: The food is excellent. Can't compare it to the island, as I have never been there. Tastes great though. The Kalua pork with cabbage had great flavor and was not dried out. Rice was good too. Add in the cold macaron it salad and it is even better. Only bad thing from my perspective was that my table was dirty. Couldn't see anything else wrong with this. Great food and a nice crew.

FMPzJADgkWKbojPRuKb5kw.text: Great authentic Hawaiian food. Tried the Loco Moco & Hawaiian Style Roast Pork. Portions are very generous for the price. Most food are under $10. Finished off with the Chantilly & Guava Cake. Very good!!! Just like on the island. Will definitely be back for more and this place is highly recommended!

jzdR-A9ArZvkOFyDYn9H1A.text: Small shop with 7 tables that sat 4.  Tried the Loco Moco with eggs over easy, one egg oozed the yolk the other a little over done but no matter the brown sauce and portion size made up for it.  I almost dropped the container because it was so heavy with food.  Also ordered the Avo Poke, again good quality fish.  Recommend this for the freshness of the food.

mvzCY2oGsjqXAASLOlQ7pg.text: Smaller than the other Island Flavor on the west side, but the food is just as good.  I went with the furikake chicken and the Korean chicken.  Really solid dishes.  The mini-mall is a little sketchy, but go here for the food.  Plenty of tables to eat here, but we got it to go.

8ZD1ecCCUGYtGty-FDxJzA.text: Finally they made a location closer. The other location is somewhere in the galaxy for us. We used to frequent the other location when we lived in Southern Highlands. If you're looking for quality Hawaiian food that's authentic this is bar none best in Vegas. Forget L&L forget Aloha Kitchen. Yah they're ok but they're not authentic like Island Flavor. When we're not at home in the 808 state, this is honestly the closest we can get to home. Some of our favorites are the roast pork the loco moco or they fried rice with Portuguese sausage. Everything here is good here and the portions are huge so come hungry. Staff is nice and always super friendly. 5 shakas for Island Flavor. Even more now they're closer! Yay!

14Xm_5b7MSQ7qUum8ShimQ.text: Great food but.....  Just recently went in to order my favorite Kalbi short rib plate which originally cost ($11.00).... today 3/13/2018 I paid ($17.00) for the NEW KALBI PLATE price?!! That's just too much.  That's a $6 increase.  Ridiculous.

smEymoa1LSwAZ_gq6Ss1rA.text: I eat here at least once a week because i work down the street but the food is always delicious, fair price and the service is awesome! They make you feel like ohana. Got my coworkers addicted to the masubi's

dTvnqjLxHq0P1gUbll-7Gg.text: Fantastic food!! My husband and I shared the mixed plate and still had some to take home. Very friendly staff! Smells delicious as soon as you get out of your car to head inside. Thank you Island Flavor!!

bfGz5nac9OM43dG7uwbJaw.text: Garlic Miso Ahi side mac salad and some Limu Ahi Poke. WINNAHz Mahalo Bruce and the outstanding Island Flavor Express staff. #hi2sin #yoliapproved

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Miso Ahi side Mac salad and some Limu Ahi Poke. WINNAHz Mahalo Bruce and the outstanding Island Flavor staff. #hi2sin #yoliapprved

OWx9ErmfJOWY_A_4L1OgWg.text: Furikake Chicken is addictive! Love the place! Clean, good vibes, fast service, can order through yelp!

YC83U7xyffogNMnC535MfA.text: I love this company but I much prefer the Durango location. I know this is an Express location but sometimes you just want to sit down & eat. I feel like the furikake chicken at this location isn't as flavorful but it is still good. Not many seating options because of the small space. It is also very loud here with the kitchen being open. Customer service is decent but overall if you want to try Island Flavor go to the Durango location.

w_S_5seDH5CyWFofOkMqJA.text: This is my new go-to when I am in town for business.  Being from Hawaii and living in Houston, coming to the Vegas area serves one purpose for me: Hawaiian grinds.  A lot of Hawaiian places do not take AmEx, which is fine but I would rather use my company card when on the road.  It's not a deal maker or breaker for me, but it instantly gives them at least half a star for my purposes.  The food is so ono!  Last night I ordered the mixed plate with katsu and kalbi.  The mac salad is legit.  The chicken katsu was moist, which is rare for a thin cut like that.  The kalbi was delicious!  The rice was perfectly cooked.  It's the best Hawaiian food I've had since leaving Pearl City.  The decor is nothing fancy... as it should be.  The Jawaiian music is playing.  The people are nice and take the time to learn the names of their customers.  This place just feels like home.  I am going back for lunch today since I have to leave tomorrow.  This place will definitely be on my "must eat at" list whenever I am in town.  Mahalo!!

sQAHJG30dN_1XCQUcYyEUQ.text: 9/10 for hawaiian flavor, this place is the best I've tried so far. 5x better then L&L bbq and better then ono hawaiian bbq in LA. The Mix plate with kalbi and the fried chicken bites with glaze sauce, I forgot the name lol, but was excellent! I would definitely take the 12 min drive from the vegas strip to island flavor for Hawaiian food.

Nwie40M0w2YMETYTSwRCgA.text: As a college student, this place is value and delicious at its finest. For around $10 you have a delicious dinner and leftovers for lunch the next day. Definitely recommend the furikake chicken, fried rice, Kalbi ribs, and poke! Small place but fast service!

icQ-1qOjh9-DGo8md6BcQA.text: Great portions awesome food born and raised in Hawaii lot's of local grind spots In Vegas. This place is the best!!

AqSbP-oc70ZCYKOzRqJEkQ.text: Love Island Flavor!!!! Everything is yummy!!! One of the first places I recommend when people are looking for local food!!

MbDISMwJu8U5e4FEF4tM0w.text: our first visit to this location!  We've been to their other location several times and at both places that poke is No Ka Oi!!!!!!!!  The Kalbi, Katsu and Roast pork and Mac salad are all on point too!  It was nice because they substitute rice for fries which my boys loved!  Going back for lunch tomorrow and maybe on Sunday before we leave haha!

wteQ4kGEzzILtYCREAr_iQ.text: This is place is for real. The best plate lunch place and I'm a local from the islands.  The hamburger steak is awesome and almost as good as Dots. But you need to try the furikaki shrimp, and Kalbi with fried rice as this combo is off the hook. I wish they would open up a location in California but I make sure I stop by every time I'm in Vegas for some good grind.

1m5Tdzf4DzbtnAcndl5HNQ.text: For the taste, quality, and quantity of the food, Island flavor should be in some high traffic location with big signs and a line out the door ALWAYS. Lucky for me, it is right next door to my community, and in a quiet lot, (so the line isn't THAT long whenever I come in). It's one of the Vegas' Hawaiian community's best kept secrets! I crave this place once a week at LEAST. It's fresh, delicious, and worth every penny.

FLNnUYsrGQc-wUFVuwtRjw.text: Beyond delicious food, I was just disappointed when they forgot part of our order. They made up for it by giving us free dessert though (Cocoa Puffs) which were PHENOMENAL. Also, their spam musubis were fresh and authentic. Love this place.

5IYCP4EUiUs3URVWhN-m0w.text: First time here. I had a craving for Loco Moco and was not disappointed. Came early lunch and it was packed. Loco Moco had a 10 oz patty, enough for two. Rice was a little over cooked but the flavors made up for it. My wife had Kalbi Short Ribs with brown rice. Also delicious and tender. Huge portions easy to split. Service is friendly and for sure will make this a regular since it is very close to us. I doubt you would be disappointed.

5bcOW9lV3xNReowPRdJm-A.text: First time there! I got the furikake chicken and my bf got the Hawaiian poke. It was so good and I got a lot of chicken I actually went home with a lot of leftovers and I eat ALOOOOT. Also, there was a bit of a wait so she threw in a free musubi! I thought that was awesome. Prices are $10-15 per item

zmGSuqNigRvuHQAeSakxNA.text: The Beef Teriyaki Steak plate was so good. The meat was tender and juicy, the way it should be! I will be coming back for more.

J3LPpJ3aIcJYW1y1TUdw2Q.text: Just tried this place out for the first time. The food was great and it was easy to find. There's a lot of parking available and the staff were friendly...for the most part. I stood at the front counter to pick up my order for a few minutes waiting for staff to acknowledge me. There was a couple of chefs chatting but never said anything to me or called anyone else out to tend to me. The cashier finally showed up but that was a little awkward. Aside from that, their food is way better than the standard Hawaiian joints in town.

GUrwuql1E_AfG17DgzlN9w.text: Fabulous Pork spare rib lunch special for Wednesday and nice service. They served us 3 Kimchi packs for free when we asked, Awsome!

Iz2IIBzdna4AFe133-lGNQ.text: I love this place! Service is attentive. Food is affordable with big portions. Really delicious food. Whenever I'm in town I have to eat here

X9oHKRs0d_4pEOWIUcTgQA.text: This is always one of my favorite spots to have some legit Hawaiian food.  The Teri beef is truly incomparable, it's thick cut, perfectly flavored, and hard to stop eating.   The furikake chicken is not my favorite, it's well flavored but I'm not a huge fried food fan. It tastes great, but not my thing.   The service is ALWAYS fantastic and I am truly a forever customer of this restaurant! Open up on the North side!!

r2FWudqCks6xZB_zSpamLg.text: Boycott this place. New OWNERSHIP SUCKS!!! This place will never own up the how Bruce and his wife ran it. Shame shame shame.   To the Employee that was HUMILIATED in front of a full house of customers FILE A DEFAMATION CLAIM!!!!!   Food sucks, prices suck.   See my post on Facebook when I reached out to her back in June NO BUENO!!!!!!!   Lilo

slTj7PjKy5Lv5cWMbUU8wg.text: This is the place if you can't make it to Aloha Specialities.   Local atmosphere, friendly staff who will remember you if you go back 3 days in a row (like I did), and beef stew (only made on Saturdays)  price range is good, quality is good, quantity is "LARGE".  One combo meal is a All day meal (if you had to hole up in room for 2 day).   Definitely a must stop when in Vegas for "lik grind"

LvcYuZ8tuG6Qr7wy_oiTHw.text: I heard this place was good...it wasn't that good...I wanted it to be good...it wasn't...also, I wanted to be able to sit...I couldn't...maybe because there are only 5 tables...ordered katsu and spam and eggs...in conclusion, if you want to stand up and eat not very good food, this is your spot...

TtYeucoFQ4gLRzsN3iwnUA.text: The meat was almost cooked jerky style but pretty good. The slice of pie pure heaven! Nice people working here great Hawaiian music overall nice place

FujTy-I0Y0GTvbuRtOTcPQ.text: The real deal. Delicious islander food. Just wish they werent out of Guava cake everytime I visit!

PnvrSm2-lDWUNEz2kqs3rQ.text: I usually get the same thing chicken katsu and kalbi. Each time the kalbi is cooked to my liking, and the Katsu is very juicy and crunchy. The cashier lady (don't remember aunties name) is very nice! They do have limited seating though so during lunch time you may have to get your food to go.

0PMZEsyuYt5TtI9oRyg14A.text: Great Hawaiian Food!  Here are some of the highlights:  1. Large portions, food for the next meal...yeah!  2. Great taste- man, i have no idea of the sodium level I am at leaving, but who cares, this is local food at its best.  3.  Need I say more - Korean chicken, Spam Musubi, Saimin, Poke, Oxtail Soup ( at times), Kalbi Short Ribs, Furikake Chicken, Chicken Teriyaki and more.  The choices here are excellent.  I wish they had the saimin and oxtail all the time.   4.  Service - This is more self serve, order and sit down, they will bring things out to you too.  Everyone is great and courteous.  Very efficient.  5.  The only issue.... - They are too small unlike their main store off Durango.  Sometimes it is too busy here.  I really like this place as a go to when I am hankering for some good ole homestyle food!  GK says check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed plate. Kalbi and Korean chicken with brown rice.
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon. Special!

qp8mMsdbmnnV_nXeRgcc9g.text: This is my favorite Hawaiian food in town. So why 3 stars? Because they're always so rude and uncaring. The service is horrible, but I go back for the food. I'm glad I don't crave Hawaiian food all that much otherwise I'd probably avoid this place and go up the street to Ohana where the service is way more friendly.   Anyway, the last time I came in, there were 3 women up at the seating area. I had ordered to go. All 3 women had seen me and I smiled at them, but all looked away and continued doing what they were doing. I understand being busy, but at least say hi, especially if I've already maintained eye contact and smiled at you.   It took a good few minutes for one of them to finally verbally acknowledge me and gather my order. There was another order right next to mine. After I paid, they just started to walk away. I said, "oh are both these bags mine?" And she said, "no, just this one" and looked annoyed. Okayyyyyy so then how would I know whose is whose, I'm not a mind reader.   Will I be back? Probably within the next 6 months, sure. This wasn't the first time there were blatantly rude. Could be the culture? I've been to Hawaii multiple times and have cousins from there but they all seems nice...no idea what's going on here?

6Z9YGr953Lz2yzsJLXFsDQ.text: I've dined at my fair share of Hawaiian "BBQ" style restaurants and this one is definitely in the upper rankings!   The hallmark of Hawaiian BBQ is the macaroni salad- theirs is beyond reproach. Chicken katsu and chicken teriyaki combo plate was exactly what it should be as well. Portions are big as well, so make sure you have an appetite!   The menu is reasonably priced and service was friendly and quick, definitely a good option for lunch. I'll be back for sure:)

yKRbzWDgPOO-WK2XcTtQBg.text: On my 4th furikake shrimp my stomach felt funny. Might've got food poising. Wasn't happy with the service either, food took along time.

zlXU3rKDsvfwhTd0gCntbA.text: My family and I love coming here! It's really close to our business and the people are always friendly and caring. This place gets very busy and for a good reason, the food is great. The macaroni salad is really great, one of my favorite reasons for coming here. Try this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FyixFxZlutpyddcawop1Cw.text: I was in Vegas with my hubby for his work and I had to have lunch alone one day. I had been craving Hawaiian food and this restaurant happened to be pretty close to the hotel we stayed at and since I'm a horrible driver in places I'm not familiar with, I figured I needed to stay close by. I'm so glad I did because this place is amazing. The chicken katsu entree was absolutely delicious. The price was great especially for the amount of food they give you, I couldn't even finish my plate. The customer service was excellent. Everything was fresh and tasted just as good and authentic as it would if you were eating it in Hawaii.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Katsu

6z5bVM8G-W8V7yfnrknZQw.text: Ordered the special of the day the Pork Adobo and it was delicious and came with a large salad per my request for $9! We also ordered their shoyu poke to try it out. It was very good, the tuna chunks were large and pink. I have a favorite poke spot in Vegas already but Island Flavor didn't disappoint! Definitely stop by if you're looking for local food.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FMPMgpsEEosNFjF4OZsG5A.text: One of the Best plate lunch restaurants in Vegas or Henderson. Real Locals, real plate lunch. Huge portions and friendly service. Besides the regular menu they have daily specials and Poke too.

4BuuI7C0CtISiTEr22aJSg.text: This is the best Hawaiian food place I've had in Vegas! I love their furikake chicken and kalbi short ribs. OMG. So good! I get the combo plate so that I can have a little bit of both. It comes with rice and macaroni salad as well. The customer service here is also excellent! There was quite a wait last time I was here during their lunch rush hour, which is expected. We didn't have any complaints, but the woman working the cashier was still generous enough to offer us a free soda and spam musubis. She interacted with customers on a personable level, which felt very genuine and nice. I highly recommend Island Flavor!

pfVrJz4UUH4bUK7wkrBWdg.text: Just a step above all other Hawaiian joints in Vegas. Freshly made with a lot of love, the quality and flavors are off the charts at Island Flavors. This is the spot for your Hawaiian fix

Tc6WzR1EjOnz_VLjgBx5Aw.text: Simply amazing!! No better island food around!! Furikake shrimp and chicken are the best

IhDWjWUq8-YL88ZXHDNBbg.text: Absolutely delicious. Highly recommend the Kalua pork and the poke bowl (spicy avocado style). Pro tip: get extra teriyaki sauce for the pork.

rtvp3EKvxMRx5utkTwsTRA.text: We wanted a place with rice and we weren't disappointed at all!! Food portion was a really good amount of food. One plate could probably fed two people unless you're really hungry haha my kids are really picky eaters and they really enjoyed their short ribs and rice plate. It was a good home cooked meal away from home. I would definitely recommend this place!

XWImzP9XnCZ7c01IQT6gow.text: I have heard from a couple friends that I had to come eat here! One who moved from Hawaii and raves about this local spot. So glad we decided to come eat here for dinner!  The chefs were friendly from the moment we walked in. The cashier Shugs was very helpful and polite when we ordered from her. The food was amazing and was served in generous portions! Overall a great spot on all levels!

2suUohID2_dThlrdQItQrQ.text: This was a bit of a shock for me. The food we got was overpriced and bland. Two Kalua Pig and Cabbage and one side of Korean Fried Chicken was nearly $40.  May try it again the future just in case the experience was a fluke, but first impression was not good.

vk17KPKikh54ibtHVN-iPQ.text: Love the food here! Tried it a month ago and it's become one of my favorite spots of here in NV! The teriyaki chicken & Kaula pork w/ cabbage I luv!!! This place is a hidden gem and a must try!

E08GxN893mDKb70sBQ-CXw.text: Omg. Stopped here on my way home from work. Got furikake chicken, chicken katsu and their special..... Sweet sour Spareribs  oh god it was delish!!!!! I miss the sweet sour spareribs that I grew up with in Hawaii and this hit the fricken spot! Island Flavor is always our go-to for island favorites and never disappoints.

VG5GqJLCxrULpEp8lLXNUw.text: Well the food is pretty good but for a plate of furikake chicken and fried rice to go from 12 to 16 buck, cant do it. Gonna have to find a new spot.

5JZ7IyB3rZLZiRTLg-C_uA.text: Super good food. Not like the typical L&L bbq you see all around Las Vegas. This food tastes home cooked, so good like it came straight from Hawaii cooked by someone's grandma type of food. Their portions are huge so you can definitely share! The waitresses and waiters are very nice and always welcoming when we're there. It feels like Hawaii when we're there and we love it! The only negative I have is that its kind of small and every time we go it's packed. Their food is way to dang good and it's always packed!! lol but I guess that's a good thing right?! I'm just being selfish and want to eat their food when I want.

4gku6ImUSS2FQ-oUti50KA.text: Love their kalbi short ribs! Very flavorful and huge portions- enough to split for two meals or eat it all if you're super hungry. Broiled and marinated well. Not like other places where u are basically paying for the bones - u get a lot of meat here. You can substitute white rice for brown rice, sauteed veggies (green/yellow zucchini and onions), or salad if u prefer. They were remodeling the last time I went, but the restaurant is kept clean. Service is quick and friendly.

b2DzP6lWRWCaBZqH0p-EVg.text: Huge portions! The food is delicious. The employees are super friendly. My son treats me to Island flavor occasionally and it is always a super special treat! My husband and I now travel all the way from North Las Vegas just to enjoy The food!

FwHY1Iyh0ajNNifWpFX4uA.text: Craving Hawaiian food? This is your spot! I've gone here a few times now and every time it's been legit. I'm not Hawaiian so I can't really touch on authenticity, but flavor, they don't disappoint!   Things we've had:  Adobo  Kimchi fried rice  Furakaki chicken  Mochiko chicken Loco moco Beef stew Korean chicken  All 5 stars!!  I'd have photos, but let's be real I killed that shit before I could take a photo.

W5eRV_6S-mcq0OjNO8akxQ.text: One of my favorite hawaiian restaurants creates a sister location much closer to me! My answers have been prayers! confused? So am I since this location is not like the original one on durango.  Setting: In the regal colonade plaza on pebble, it is right next to a smoke shop and on the side of PT's Ranch. A smaller restaurant but still places to sit and eat.   Service: Service here is fantastic. I have never received bad service especially from a Hawaiian restaurant. The young lady behind the counter was very engaging and we ended up talking more than I had time to eat haha.  Food: Ok the most important part. The furikake chicken and kalbi are the stars of this show here. Luckily the kalbi is still on point but their signature furikake chicken is different. They over fry and batter their furikake chicken and makes them really hard and crunchy. NO BUENO!!! Cut back on the batter and don't fry them to the point where they're gonna start popping like popcorn. Also AVOID AVOID getting the furikake shrimp, same story as the chicken and they only give you 4 pieces of shrimp.  Overall: I want to just drive to the original location but this spot is way more convenient. Pleaseeeee follow up on my review about the frying process! Thanks guys!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi with furkikake shrimp. Do not get the shrimp
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed plate with kalbi and furikake chicken
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I can&#39;t even close the box it&#39;s so much food

kaXbuH2gvz4ygq3x9EfUgw.text: If you been wanting to go to Hawaii but can't because tickets are unreasonably overpriced, this place will make you feel like you took a trip to island paradise at a very affordable cost.   I had the furikake chicken and can I just say dayummm. It was an explosion of flavor and crispiness that spread throughout my tongue and left me wanting for more with each bite. It was perfectly sauced, tasting a bit sweet which balanced out with the white rice. Portion size of the chicken and rice itself was very generous. I felt so full that I went back to my friend's apartment and took an hour nap due to food coma. You know somethings good if you had to rest and recover for that long. The meal also came with macaroni salad that was also delicious. I'm generally not the biggest fan Mac salad because most places put too much mayo but this was had the perfect proportion. I would've finished it if the they didn't give so much rice and chicken. Being from LA, this is definitely a pit stop the next time I go to Vegas and make more almost regrettable decisions.

ukIyWqQR2yNQ5ndiVVGArw.text: I usually order the two meat dinner with chicken katsu and beef short ribs and it has always been really good. I haven't ordered from here in months!!! So I decided to order my fav two meat dinner again and I don't know what happened but it was TERRIBLE!!!! The chicken katsu was over cooked and burnt, there were chunks in my gravy, and the mac salad was inedible...the mac salad was watery!!!  Maybe they changed cooks or management, I don't know, but I will not come back here again if the food continues to be as terrible as it was this time!!!!!   UPDATE: the owner has changed...the food has been good so far!

IZzWxO_2utQ7uGfcg9Xk4Q.text: I went back after a short absence, more about timing than anything. I am happy to report that the food is as I have enjoyed since they first opened. I was a Thursday and Friday regular after work. I got a hamburger steak/ furikaki chicken plate and a Teri beef/ furikaki chicken plate. They were very generous with portions and it was ono. I thought that perhaps new ownership had changed this little gem. After a wonderful conversation with Isaiah, I realized that nothing has changed, same people, same great service, new chef adding more specials and the new owners are really working hard at connecting with community of Islanders and doing better. I am so glad the timing was there last night to make it for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikaki chicken and Hamburger steak plate and Teri beef/ Furikaki chicken plate. Mops on these plates than moimoi.

9VpOf686RnKhKIE83oQ6rQ.text: Da BOMB! Sister had teriyaki steak - melt in your mouth beef - full of flavor! I had pork adobo - OMG so good! Don't remember what my niece had! LOL. BTW, the mac salad is the best I've ever had!

Tp6sm9wBur7a-uGRTL_Mkw.text: What happened to this place?  It going down hill....  New owners, lack of aloha, menu and portions not the same.

2wjNBCbOIEGu_WBJQSKeSg.text: I ordered online through yelp eat 24 20min in advanced. Eat 24 takes a few minutes to process and send them the order. I arrived to the restaurant 16min after eat24 said the restaurant received my order. I show up to counter ask for my food and they have no clue who ordered until they look for the slip and now i have to wait another 15-20min at that point i want my money back and leave. The main reason was for me for me ordering online was to arrive to have yhe food ready and not wait any more time. This is actually the 3rd time this has happened to me only at this location. Dont think ill be ordering online forbthis place any more. They just dont pay attention  AND IF YOU DO DECIDE TO ORDERUIO ONLINE  MAKE SURE YOU ORDER ATLEAST 1HR in advanced because they might be barley checkimg the hidden printer they have near the ceiling in the back to see if they have any onlines.

dEd9CY29Fo-IJ5F9rRoycg.text: Went here for the first time today.food was amazing!nice clean eating area an nice tv to watch while u eat.i dined in for lunch with my wife an we waited until our name was called to get up an get our food.i didn't like that at all after seeing some cops come in an they got catered to while they sat down.ALL CUSTOMERS DESERVE TO BE SERVED IF THEY ARE DINING IN!!thats common courtesy an will take u a long way in life!!jus because a cop is a customer that shouldn't make them better then all the other customers.we should all be treated Equal because we all come here with our hard earned money to eat.besides that,THE FOOD WAS AWESOME AN nice friendly clean environment

DWCMDGmTAfKXo5Vk6XJ2gg.text: Perfect place to go when you're hangry.... take your hanger frustration out on this place. Its hard to find authentic poke in Las Vegas and island flavor by far has THE best!!! Super fresh and delicate! .... just sayin. Portions are large as well. Thanks for the good food and service.

HGJpNn_c_fcyWq8kHE0H_A.text: I eat here at least twice a week.  Always the same thing.  Mixed plate with their furikake chicken and Kali ribs with fried rice.  The staff is always amazing and the food is quick.  I can't recommend this place enough.  Kahele who works the front is fantastic at customer service.  I don't write reviews often but this is one of those rare places that compels me to do so.

m-HJbfMr20BcZZaMiNR3OQ.text: Love kalbi here. My fav is a mix plate of kalbi and Furukawa chicken and loco moco for kids. Oh I can eat here everyday!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E-mn7PYnt0__IFGL_7ct5A.text: Visiting from San Diego for my son's baseball tournament and I was in need of some local grinds cus I'm sick of burger and fries!  Stumbled upon this gem and let's just say we're going back for lunch again today! Mac salad, teri steak, teri chix, furikake chix, chix katsu and shoyu poke all on point!  Cashier was super nice as well!  The only "con" is their spot is too small with only four - four tops.  Won't stop us from going back though!  Take out is always an option!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plate on the left - furikake chix and kalua pork and cabbage.  Plate on the right - teri steak and teri chix.  Delish!!!!!
Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shoyu poke...YUM!!!

s9dEG5bMj2VNMHx2_Uzmqw.text: Can't get enough of this spot... Awesome friendly staff, and amazing food. Theres nothing more you can ask for. My staple is the Furikaki Chicken... juicy on the inside, crispy on the outside, and the sweet and savory notes from the coated sauce just pops. The teriyaki beef is also another great choice. My only con is that the place is very small; 4-5 tables max... considering its always packed when I go... I always order "to-go"

11y4gQEFuRmelnajJWjEBA.text: I love their original location and I'm so happy they have one closer to where I live...every item on the menu is good (& huge portions) so you can't go wrong no matter what you choose...my favorite is the furikake chicken and the furikake poke...  also thank you to the uncle who hooked us up with a free block of kulolo today   (they get fresh poi on Thursday's and fresh kulolo on Fridays)

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

03OyIQpiBElI5i5UfPvBAw.text: I've never had Furikake Chicken and it was amazing! One yelper mentioned it was like "The Hawaiian version of orange chicken" and that's what it is minus the orange flavor. The best part is that it's made fresh so it is extremely crunchy and did not have a soggy breading texture like panda express. The macaroni salad is delicious and not as tangy as L&L. I wish their portions for the macaroni salad was bigger!  The short ribs were delicious, flavorful and had great char marks.  Also had the guava cake, the cake itself and the guava jam is really good. Not overly sweet and the guava flavor is noticeable. I just was not a fan of the cool whip frosting. I love real whipped cream. Will probably stick with the Furikake Chicken only, for next time!  Service was great!

DnAwJ_M0xSDI5UbcO-X8kQ.text: I've been to Island Flavor a few times now, and I've finally remembered to write a review. It's a small location with 4-5 tables, but you're there for the food, right?   Food is made to order there. It's fresh, you can watch them make your food. Portions are big and Service is always friendly.   I'll go back!!!

QOchQRfjrU944OV1IxNOeA.text: What else can be said about this place that already hasn't been said.  Great food, good staff. Never a really long wait...

BTI0FkvdQu0Ax-bxvJzKiw.text: Love Island Flavor!  We were introduced to Island Flavor when they catered a Halloween party at my kids Karate dojo. The food was so good that our family stopped by and tried it out.  Our favorites to get are the Beef Teriyaki Steak, Kalibi Short Ribs, and the Ahi Poke. The staff is always friendly and the food is always great.  They were super nice when we came in at 8:30 pm to dine-in. (They close at 9.) Our kids eat slow, but they did not mind that we left 5 minutes after they closed. We didn't feel rushed at all to eat our food and get out of there.

g2nTa0A34RVa7KTIRBQ7WA.text: My favorite Hawaiian BBQ! Mac salad is amazing and the furikake chicken is to die for!! The teriyaki beef is so tender always!! Mix plates are enough for two!

ke-kgAB3z1EBYsu8x2WNmw.text: I have been coming back to this place! The food is amazing and I love the Big Island feel you get when you come in. Everyone is so friendly and down to earth. Must try the BEEF teriyaki

63cZHtUuqczss2JpDxIgFQ.text: My family came to Island Flavor after hearing good reviews, and we were not disappointed! The poke (we got the Avo Poke) was the best I've ever had--and I'm a huge poke fan. The furikake chicken was delicious; it was crispy with tons of furikake flavor. The beef teriyaki was tender and perfectly cooked. We also got the chicken katsu, kalua pork, shrimp, & the Korean chicken, which were all good but not as tasty as the other ones.   The service was friendly & helpful. The inside was small & clean. We will definitely be back :)

HDN5U1ZGZbxTh0VrzHk1yQ.text: The best local food in Vegas most likely. They give big portions and super flavorful! Pick this spot over aloha kitchen if you're from Hawaii. Either way wherever you're from, pick this spot. I ordered the poke here and it was bomb. They also have amazing teriyaki chicken.

D_YEry730YP63aiXyHde7A.text: Furikake chicken was yum! And my family was happy with the poke and kale.  Friendly service and nice area for eat-in.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K9Xeu5GAlHSK4tV-nSCk9g.text: I love this place. Nice to have an Island Flavor on the east side/ Henderson area. Their west side location a sit down restaurant and quite a distance. Everything on the menu is tasty. Never had bad service here. I Usually call my orders in. My favorite plate on the menu is the Furikake chicken. Kalbi ribs and the Korean chicken wings are really tasty as well! Portion size are great! Can't really describe the food, but it's bomb. Check it out for yourself.

3F7ziK7zKsKH_2KEHc4Vjw.text: Nice hawaiian place outside the Vegas strip. We want to try something that is not on strip and fairly cheaper. This is a good place to eat cheap and large portion food. I like the furikake chicken the most. Amazing sauce and tender chicken. The korean chicken is awesome, similar to KFC original batter but with a sauce on it. Mixed plate is only for 11.50 which is a good deal for this type of meal. Kalbi is also amazing. Would like to eat there again if I go to Vegas again.

ZtRL9_TNB7TTTu2JKC-beg.text: Super Bowl Sunday... Last customer of the day. They closed early because it was slow. I ordered Furikake SHRIMP to go (obviously because they was closing). Got home.. Opened plate.. Got Furikake CHICKEN!! Omg! Still love this place but the cook needs to read the ticket carefully! I really was craving for SHRIMP not chicken. I even got the chili sauce for the Shrimp

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ordered Furikake shrimp- got Furikake chicken instead

jGq5zJwaR91vRHvNQodCzw.text: Totally love Island Flavor. Usually go to the one on Durango so I'm glad that I found one closer to my new place. The food is great and the atmosphere is amazing.

3mMB2cJW6ElRCX05_zsk9g.text: Omg! I lurve this place!!!! Big portions, Awesome customer service, delicious Hawaiian local food!!! I can't get enough of this place! I'm just gonna keep this short and sweet, everyone should try Island Flavor Express... It's very addicting!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Flavor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy yummy going in my tummy!!!

UWWuwXIFi4a6kG8XanlVUw.text: Tried the furikake chicken and damn!!!!   i cant say anything else other than its amazing.!

frlntoZ5iy1EoIVLRA7EKw.text: Very tasty and authentic Hawaiian eats in a fast casual environment.  The portions are very generous and orders arrive quickly.  Good stuff.

Cixok7VCRKOfw8j6uSqT_g.text: Was referred here due to just moving to the state from Hawaii and was really craving local food. I usually go to aloha specialties in California Hotel but after trying this place it is now my spot. The Kalua pig and roast pork are my favorites it's juicy and very tasty. I have tried aloha kitchen and they got nothing on Island Flavor. Best part the service here is super friendly and makes you get that Hawaiian feel greeted with a smile everyone talks and is there with a positive attitude love that keep up the good work!!!

UIKQi-bkpZruV3obKWdFmw.text: Furikake chicken -it was nice and crispy but I wanted it to have just a little bit more flavor. It was, however, a huge portion.

uOnIaiMlsbvX5S0I6FD8cg.text: Seriously, I would never come back! The service is ok but the food is just so... Im lost for words. I ordered the korean chicken, musubi, etc. The chicken was full of batter and I felt like I was going to get a heart attack just looking at it. The musubi was sitting for a while and was just below average. I guess it represents the name as Express but seriously... if you want better quality food, just go next door to Jun's in the same building! I was debating between the two and because I always go to Juns I figured id try this place out. Never again!

nEWCch_WiYKYdiemZmdi1w.text: This place is amazing, I wish I knew about it sooner, been hear 2 times in the past week and I must say I am hooked, quality of meat and flavor is top notch and they pack the foam containers to the max, also $2 spam masubi, I rarely do yelp reviews but I couldn't resist

uFFOjZ6PwtiO1lBe0MTkMw.text: Just tried this place for the first time today. Probably the best meal I have had since moving to Vegas 2 years ago, and I eat out a lot. The Kalbi ribs, furikake chicken, terrayaki chicken were all 10/10. Can not wait to come back.

jPV94_hZk9aLtAkiqfPw1A.text: Great food with big portions. Was very impressed with their shoyu poke & smoked meat w/ onions plate. Oh & finally found a place that also serves saimin--which tastes like back home! I wish I had found this place sooner!

yLvB0zZvyJtwje6IYD0kPQ.text: I'm not sure why this place is called Hawaiian because the food did not blow me away as far as something different in the US. The fried pork chop alone was flavorless and adding that brown gravy made it a little better but the gravy taste like those packets you can buy in Walmart. Nevertheless, the grill pork and fried chicken wings were a little better

jrcWvz78PBDHYRlR9MwP0g.text: First off we love coming here, but today....the crew they had really SUCKED!!!!!! It took 25mins to get 1 mixed plate, also we had ordered a musubi and was told they don't have any. Once I received my plate I could see the girl making the musubi's had 6 full rolls that she had just sitting on the cutting board. The staff today wasnt on top of things. Especially the girl making the Musubi's seemed like she didn't want to be here working just dragging her feet. Unbelievable that today this place ain't got it together...... Should've gone to the Durango location. Next time I'll watch what staff is working.

n5EQUQKQCopwAe-B1a2A_g.text: I come to that place at least two time ms a week.  Portions are huge and service is great! All their specials are amazing and the mixed plate (Chicken Furikake and Burger Steak) is just bomb and so much food! Hope this place continuous doing in the exactly same way for a long time!

mryxgx7_cIT6Z1WVXScrdw.text: I got a loco moco the patty was hard this place is not the same from wen they first open

nIMJqwk-63al8qhsITzZgw.text: Food was awesome!! Large portions and poke is fresh and flavorful. Isaiah the cashier was very nice and helpful. You can tell he is a hard worker. Even with a long line and busy to go orders he still managed to give the best service and smile to everyone who walked in the door. Will be coming back and I recommend it to people who love Hawaiian food.

09KJCZv_0D2JlHQjKOXYfA.text: My gf and I were in the area and we were super hangry and saw that there was a Hawaiian place nearby with good reviews so we decided to check it out. The lady that took our order was super nice and friendly and helpful. The place was nice and clean and comfortable with nice Hawaiian music playing. And the food. OMG the food. I got the furikake chicken and kalbi combo and let me tell you, my container was filled to the brim with food. And ah it was so so good. Kalbi ribs were nice and thick and juicy and meaty and tasted amazing (unlike some places, ahem, a place that rhymes with "a mocha thicken" comes to mind, that serve super thin kalbi ribs that are 80% fat). Furikake chicken was crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside and super flavorful. I couldn't stop eating even though I was already full, AND I still have a ton of leftovers. LOVE this place. Can't wait to come back!

FyXp07L0NRZ3s6WJ_ib11w.text: Amazingly delicious food.  Furikake chicken is a must!  Roast pork loco moco is yummy!

t3rtPLtgEQR9odZcCJfZWQ.text: I ordered the bento box with eggs, spam, teriyaki beef, chicken and rice. It was very good. Good service and the location was easy to find.

Frctv2R62GyyA4mqck00bQ.text: Our First visit was great! Ordered the mixed plate kalbi ribs and ckn furikake, it was so good!!! Loved the side of mac salad. Didn't get the name of the cashier but she was so nice and checked on us, made us feel welcomed. Walked out with more than enough for left overs. Will be referring my friends and definitely returning!

LSPD_YY-4qBql5g8uAw50A.text: Best plates in town. Portion sizes are insane and they make sure that doesn't take anything away from quality and taste of food.   My go to is the loco moco or Furikake chicken with Kalbi combo. But I recently tried the kimchi fried rice with Korean chicken wings and that definitely hit the spot when looking for something with a little kick.

sfPm9xJHlqsL5GYFkeX6og.text: Nice hole in the wall, North of 215 on Eastern so you don't have to deal with much traffic. Yummy poke!

HRK5r3XR9f8f-WJewIV1fg.text: Was told about this place from some co-workers and what can i say.... This place is awesome!! So good, Im definitely coming back.
